column1: Posizione:

La ricerca, attivata per  MBCredit Solutions , società del Gruppo Mediobanca, è volta a brillanti laureate/i in  Economia, Ingegneria, Scienze Statistiche ,  Informatica  o  Data Science , con pregressa esperienza di 2 anni in ambito business intelligence, data modelling e analisi dati per altre realtà bancarie o primarie realtà di consulenza.

La risorsa si occuperà principalmente attività di analisi, manipolazione e modellizzazione dati attraverso applicativo SAS al fine di predisporre report e analisi di valore sull’attività di recupero crediti.

Il Team di  Enterprise platforms  di  KPMG Advisory  assiste le organizzazioni nella loro trasformazione digitale, dalla strategia all'esecuzione e dalla visione al valore.
Lavoriamo con i clienti per costruire migliori relazioni con i loro acquirenti, ridurre i costi, guidare la crescita e generare valore.

Possiamo aiutarli a fare gli investimenti giusti al momento giusto, a prendere in considerazione le implicazioni più ampie della rivoluzione digitale e a integrare le innovazioni rivoluzionarie nelle loro infrastrutture tradizionali.
I nostri professionisti dei servizi finanziari forniscono un'ampia consulenza a società di assicurazioni, retail e corporate, investment banking.
Entrando a far parte del nostro team, sarete coinvolti in progetti con i seguenti compiti:
analizzare i requisiti di business attraverso sessioni di approfondimento e interviste con le aree aziendali coinvolte nel processo in momenti diversi
progettare la soluzione migliore per il cliente utilizzando soluzioni SAP standard, preconfigurate o personalizzate
analisi funzionale e tecnica dei processi end-to-end
test interni e con gli utenti della soluzione software
supporto e formazione agli utenti finali
supporto al team di progetto durante il rilascio.
Il candidato ideale deve avere:
Laurea in economia, ingegneria gestionale o simili
la motivazione a lavorare nell'ambito dell'information technology con clienti del settore dei servizi finanziari (banche e assicurazioni)
ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
ottima conoscenza di Microsoft Office.

Sei in grado di risolvere i problemi e non perdete mai di vista i tuoi obiettivi. Hai forti capacità relazionali e sei un giocatore di squadra. La tua motivazione e il tuo entusiasmo ispirano fiducia e favoriscono il cambiamento. Ti piace affrontare le sfide e ti senti tuo agio in situazioni di rapido cambiamento in cui le tue capacità di leadership fanno la differenza.

Nel mondo di oggi, sempre più complesso e interconnesso, i clienti devono trasformarsi e adattarsi sempre più rapidamente. In  KPMG Advisory  ci concentriamo sui principali fattori di cambiamento: strategie, finanza aziendale, processi e modelli organizzativi, piattaforme tecnologiche, gestione del rischio e cambiamento organizzativo. Il nostro lavoro è unico e stimolante, data la sua portata, complessità e importanza. Sperimenterete tecnologie dirompenti e definirete i nuovi standard che influiscono sulla loro sicurezza. Avrete accesso a opportunità globali e la possibilità di acquisire abilità e competenze che vi aiuteranno a raggiungere i vostri obiettivi.
I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR""), e successive modifiche.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. è un datore di lavoro con pari opportunità.
IT Business Analyst Intern - Financial Services

KPMG Advisory's   Enterprise platforms  team assists organisations throughout their digital transformation, from strategy through execution and from vision to value. We work with clients to build better relationships with their customers, cut costs, drive growth and generate value. We can help them make the right investments at the right time, consider the broader implications of the digital disruption and build breakthrough innovations into their legacy infrastructure.

Our  Financial services  professionals provide wide-ranging advice to insurance, retail and corporate, investment banking and investment management companies.    By joining our team, you will be involved in projects with the following tasks:
analysing the business requirements via in-depth sessions and interviews with the company areas involved in the process at different times
designing the best solution for the client using standard, preconfigured or customised SAP solutions
functional and technical analyses of end-to-end processes
internal tests and with users of the software solution
support and provision of training to end users
supporting the project team during the release.
The ideal candidate must have:
a master's degree in business, engineering management or similar
the motivation to work in information technology with financial services clients (banks and insurance companies)
excellent knowledge of English, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad
excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office.

You are a problem solver and never lose sight of your goals. You have strong interpersonal skills and are a team player. Your motivation and enthusiasm inspire confidence and empower change. You enjoy taking on challenges and are comfortable in fast-changing situations where your leadership abilities make the difference.

In today’s increasingly complex and interconnected world, clients need to transform and adapt ever more rapidly. At  KPMG Advisory , we focus on the main drivers of change: strategies, corporate finance, organisational processes and models, technological platforms, risk management and organisational change. Our work is uniquely challenging given its scope, complexity and importance. You will experience disruptive technologies and set the new standards that impact their security. You will have access to global opportunities and the possibility of gaining skills and expertise that will help you reach your goals.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR”), as amended.   KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer."

Typical projects within the Business and Investors Advisory (BIA) service include providing commercial, technical and economic advice to financial investors, infrastructure operators and concessionaires, governments, developers and international financial institutions in the broader infrastructure sector.

The successful candidate will be responsible for providing a range of quantitative skills, from data handling and presentation to financial/economic modelling, to our clients on a range of projects in the transport, traditional energy and social infrastructure sectors, always taking responsibility and accountability for the quality of outputs.

In this role, you will work on individual projects, typically comprising technical, commercial and environmental, social and governance (ESG) due diligence to inform lenders, buyers or sellers of infrastructure projects. The focus of the technical due diligence work is to assist in the evaluation of potential investments by identifying and assessing technical, operational, commercial and reputational risks and opportunities.
The role will also extend to carrying out wider advisory work in the public and private sectors, as appropriate to the individual's skills. Other activities may include:
Assisting with project management tasks
Contributing to research and analysis assignments
Supporting client-facing tasks.
Developing sector knowledge.
Process improvement and development.
Required:
Key requisites:

You have a relevant engineering degree, or equivalent experience with infrastructure projects including transport (highways, rails, metro, airports, smart and low emission mobility), Social infrastructures (hospitals, schools), energy (district heating, biomass, hydrogen, hydro power production).
You have 0 to 3 years of post-graduation experience and track record in commercial or transaction due diligences in the infrastructure sector.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Strong interest in and passion for infrastructure
Strong knowledge of both Excel and PowerPoint
You are fluent in both written and spoken English
Team player, good under delivery pressure whilst maintain quality outputs.
Ability to rapidly switch from infrastructure-related projects in different fields.
Rewards and Benefits

Core benefits including flexible working arrangements are made available to support and safeguard your financial, physical, and mental wellbeing.
Shape your time with us

At Arup, you'll be an encouraged member of the team with opportunities to participate in cultural and social events with the local community (e.g., as a STEM ambassador) or by joining one of our staff networks for women, culture, or LGBT+ people. You'll have access to a range of flexible working options – whether you're a parent, a career, a student, or have a busy lifestyle - we recognise it's not always easy to commit to standard working hours so if you're interested in flexible start and finish times, working from home or working part-time, please let us know when you apply, and we'll discuss how this could work in your role.

Il nostro lavoro è unico e stimolante, data la sua portata, complessità e importanza. Sperimenterete tecnologie dirompenti e definirete i nuovi standard che influiscono sulla loro sicurezza. Avrete accesso a opportunità globali e la possibilità di acquisire abilità e competenze che vi aiuteranno a raggiungere i vostri obiettivi.
I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR""), e successive modifiche.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. è un datore di lavoro con pari opportunità.
IT Business Analyst Intern - Financial Services

KPMG Advisory's   Enterprise platforms  team assists organisations throughout their digital transformation, from strategy through execution and from vision to value. We work with clients to build better relationships with their customers, cut costs, drive growth and generate value. We can help them make the right investments at the right time, consider the broader implications of the digital disruption and build breakthrough innovations into their legacy infrastructure.

Our  Financial services  professionals provide wide-ranging advice to insurance, retail and corporate, investment banking and investment management companies.    By joining our team, you will be involved in projects with the following tasks:
analysing the business requirements via in-depth sessions and interviews with the company areas involved in the process at different times
designing the best solution for the client using standard, preconfigured or customised SAP solutions
functional and technical analyses of end-to-end processes
internal tests and with users of the software solution
support and provision of training to end users
supporting the project team during the release.
The ideal candidate must have:
a master's degree in business, engineering management or similar
the motivation to work in information technology with financial services clients (banks and insurance companies)
excellent knowledge of English, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad
excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office.

You are a problem solver and never lose sight of your goals. You have strong interpersonal skills and are a team player. Your motivation and enthusiasm inspire confidence and empower change. You enjoy taking on challenges and are comfortable in fast-changing situations where your leadership abilities make the difference.

In today’s increasingly complex and interconnected world, clients need to transform and adapt ever more rapidly. At  KPMG Advisory , we focus on the main drivers of change: strategies, corporate finance, organisational processes and models, technological platforms, risk management and organisational change. Our work is uniquely challenging given its scope, complexity and importance. You will experience disruptive technologies and set the new standards that impact their security. You will have access to global opportunities and the possibility of gaining skills and expertise that will help you reach your goals.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR”), as amended.   KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer."

Bosch Sensortec  is the technology leader in sensing solutions based on microelectromechanical systems (MEMS) and dedicated to the consumer electronics world. Our success in MEMS sensors and solutions is built on a remarkable team driven by passion, innovation and flexibility.

There is more than one good reason to join  #BoschSensortec . We not only have cutting-edge product technology and an employee-oriented corporate culture, we also offer you attractive working conditions and first-class career opportunities.
We offer you many different working fields and career paths — and we provide individual possibilities to enable you to turn your passion into real innovations.  Job Description
Who will you become if you join Bosch Sensortec team?

ANALOG DESIGN ENGINEER  –  experienced in CMOS technology design. High confidence in OTA, bandgap, LDOs, currents and voltage references, Pads & ESD. Our Analog Design Engineer has Experience in low noise & low power design: Analog Front-End and Sigma-Delta ADC for sensor application with a good knowledge of most common Analog Design Tools for simulation and full blocks validation.

DIGITAL DESIGN ENGINEER :  Deep   Understanding of system architecture specifications, translating functional specifications into design requirements and writing detailed documentation of blocks implementation. Our digital design engineer Implements module and chip-level designs in VHDL hardware design language and integrates Logic BIST and customs ATE and debugs test logic.

DIGITAL VERIFICATION ENGINEER : E xperienced in Verifying Mixed-Signal and System-on-Chip ASICs for consumer and automotive applications, developing and maintaining block/top-level verification plans and development environment. Our Digital Verification Engineer has a comprehensive understanding of ASIC design processes and digital design methodologies.

DATA ANALYST ENGINEER :  In this role our engineers develop and implement big data analysis solutions to support the MEMS sensor development process. They develop software framework for efficient big data analysis, enabling cross-functional teams to work with diverse data sources and supporting the end-to-end data analysis process. Evaluation and optimization of big data solutions and improved data pipelines are also included in this role.

SENSOR EXPERT/ARCHITECT:   Focuses all technical aspects of Sensors development in collaboration with the project manager and work-package leads (ASIC, MEMS, SW, manufacturing, etc.). Sensor Architects defining and supervising the implementation of the Technical Solution in collaboration with our global expert teams. Sensor expert/Architect profile has experience in the chip/wafer technology development and deep technical understanding of MEMS technology.

MEMS Sensor PROJECT MANAGER   - Lead cross-functional teams in developing MEMS sensor projects, from planning to execution. Responsibilities include defining project scope, managing resources, ensuring technical excellence, and mitigating risks. The role includes effective communication with stakeholders, adherence to timelines and budgets, and continuous improvement. Strong leadership, project management, and technical skills in MEMS sensor technology are essential elements.

MEMS DESIGNER  – Focuses on designing the mechanical and electrical behavior of new MEMS structures based on specific customer requirements. The role includes carrying out dedicated simulations to optimize the designed MEMS structures with focus on Inertial or environmental sensors, developing new algorithms for design optimization and improve simulation methods, in close cooperation with project management and technology development. Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.
As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +400 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.
Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.
About the Role

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely & professional delivery of our projects. Examples of the sort of project work you will be part of delivering within the first year of your role include but are not limited to
column2: the creation and monitoring of complex dashboards aimed at aggregating findings from numerous data sources
column3: the evaluation of client’s existing marketing channel mix and the recommendation of the most suitable attribution model
column4: the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

column1: Responsibilities

Delivering high quality outcomes for a variety of projects in the Ad Tech and Web Analytics space, working in a client-facing position, supported by a team of technical specialists

column2: foreseeing and escalating issues / risks as appropriate

column1: Developing a sharp, operational expertise regarding web analytics and media-buy topics

Progressing in your journey at fifty-five, you will be given the opportunity to grow in your role through first-hand exposure to multiple disciplines and, if interested, you might be selected to take a specialist path.

Educated to degree level

Analytical mindset, keen to apply data to challenges
Detail oriented, proactive and self-motivated, good organisation is paramount
A confident presenter
Curious and eager to learn, able to challenge and recommend solutions to problems
Flexible, versatile and works well under pressure
Collaborative, works well in a team, understands that the sum of our parts is better than the individual
Strong interest in new marketing technologies & the digital industry
Interest in working in a small, growing team
If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.

Being part of a multicultural, dynamic and fast-growing team
Continuous (and certified) training on the digital ecosystem and technologies (initial training for all new employees, followed by recurring training sessions)
Phone allowance
The flexibility to work remotely for part of the week - this will continue post Covid
UnMind App subscription

Your role and primary responsibilities

We’re looking for an outstanding Data Analyst who can actively contribute to the operations of a fast growing fintech scaleup. It will involve challenging tasks, real technical projects and a day-to-day interaction with the rest of the team.
It is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience at the intersection between the AI space and the financial sector.
If you have a background rooted in finance, computer skills, are a self-starter, highly dependable and enjoy being part of a growing team, then we are looking for you!
Your tasks will include

Work directly both with our R&D division and with our Mission Control team on data analytics projects using our internal tools, spreadsheets and Python scripts for exploratory data analysis, modeling, visualization, performance evaluation and report generation
Research and deliver insights related to risk exposures, portfolio construction, and quantitative analysis of the investment process
Evaluating and interpreting the outputs of the models from an economic and financial point of view.
Producing clear written summaries of research results.
Skills required
Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or related technical fields
1+ years of work experience in a industry, university, or government lab, in a role with primary emphasis on AI research

Strong skills in statistical modeling and machine learning, especially techniques such as bagging, random forests, gradient boosting, hyperparameter optimization techniques, Bayesian models, neural networks, time series analysis, signal processing etc.
Relevant coding experience in programming languages such as Python (or equivalent)
Excellent teamwork skills are a must
Creativity and ability to formulate problems and solve them both in team and independently
Willing to work towards long-term ambitious research goals, while identifying intermediate milestones and meeting deadlines
Fluent in English both spoken and written
Bonus points
Knowledge of how financial markets work
Knowledge of JAVA and Spring framework
Proficiency in SQL
Knowledge of Version Control Systems (GIT)
Knowledge of AWS
Interest in Big Data tools and framework like Apache Spark
MDOTM Benefits
Flexible smart working policies
Annual retreat for the team in an awesome location
Professional development under the lead of a senior member
Free coffee and snacks
Office kitchen and common spaces"

Introdurre strutture comuni di allocazione dei costi e reportistica in conformità con i GAAP finanziari locali
Your activities:
Incontri con il cliente per la raccolta e razionalizzazione dei requisiti di dettaglio

Job summary
You will join our Investment Solutions Department, a business area that aims to centralize all the portfolio management and investment advisory services offered to our clients.

Under the supervision of the Head of Investment Solutions & Portfolio Management, you will work in direct support of our Portfolio Managers to discover the full scope of our business. More in detail, you will have the possibility to:
work on the implementation of indicators and dashboards providing the managers with continuously updated financial data
work on the development of tools to monitor stock market positions
carry out various data analysis activities, market analyses and researches, also participating in the stock selection process
prepare PowerPoint presentation documents, reports, performance files, etc. intended for sales campaigns or for clients meetings and committees
participate in portfolio analysis, in the analysis of asset allocation proposals and in portfolio construction
write commentaries and reports
check executed orders

You will be exposed to a challenging and rapidly changing international environment, which requires multi-tasking skills, relating to multiple key people within the organization, and meeting tight deadlines. This experience will provide you with the opportunity to enhance your knowledge of asset allocation and portfolio construction for clients belonging to the High or Ultra High Net Worth Individuals target, with a focus on both traditional and innovative investment instruments.

Why Join Us?    We are a global company with over 1,700 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you. Sobi Culture    At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases, and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.    As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

Bosch Sensortec  is the technology leader in sensing solutions based on microelectromechanical systems (MEMS) and dedicated to the consumer electronics world. Our success in MEMS sensors and solutions is built on a remarkable team driven by passion, innovation and flexibility.

There is more than one good reason to join  #BoschSensortec . We not only have cutting-edge product technology and an employee-oriented corporate culture, we also offer you attractive working conditions and first-class career opportunities.
We offer you many different working fields and career paths — and we provide individual possibilities to enable you to turn your passion into real innovations.  Job Description
Who will you become if you join Bosch Sensortec team?

ANALOG DESIGN ENGINEER  –  experienced in CMOS technology design. High confidence in OTA, bandgap, LDOs, currents and voltage references, Pads & ESD. Our Analog Design Engineer has Experience in low noise & low power design: Analog Front-End and Sigma-Delta ADC for sensor application with a good knowledge of most common Analog Design Tools for simulation and full blocks validation.

DIGITAL DESIGN ENGINEER :  Deep   Understanding of system architecture specifications, translating functional specifications into design requirements and writing detailed documentation of blocks implementation. Our digital design engineer Implements module and chip-level designs in VHDL hardware design language and integrates Logic BIST and customs ATE and debugs test logic.

DIGITAL VERIFICATION ENGINEER : E xperienced in Verifying Mixed-Signal and System-on-Chip ASICs for consumer and automotive applications, developing and maintaining block/top-level verification plans and development environment. Our Digital Verification Engineer has a comprehensive understanding of ASIC design processes and digital design methodologies.

DATA ANALYST ENGINEER :  In this role our engineers develop and implement big data analysis solutions to support the MEMS sensor development process. They develop software framework for efficient big data analysis, enabling cross-functional teams to work with diverse data sources and supporting the end-to-end data analysis process. Evaluation and optimization of big data solutions and improved data pipelines are also included in this role.

SENSOR EXPERT/ARCHITECT:   Focuses all technical aspects of Sensors development in collaboration with the project manager and work-package leads (ASIC, MEMS, SW, manufacturing, etc.). Sensor Architects defining and supervising the implementation of the Technical Solution in collaboration with our global expert teams. Sensor expert/Architect profile has experience in the chip/wafer technology development and deep technical understanding of MEMS technology.

MEMS Sensor PROJECT MANAGER   - Lead cross-functional teams in developing MEMS sensor projects, from planning to execution. Responsibilities include defining project scope, managing resources, ensuring technical excellence, and mitigating risks. The role includes effective communication with stakeholders, adherence to timelines and budgets, and continuous improvement. Strong leadership, project management, and technical skills in MEMS sensor technology are essential elements.

MEMS DESIGNER  – Focuses on designing the mechanical and electrical behavior of new MEMS structures based on specific customer requirements. The role includes carrying out dedicated simulations to optimize the designed MEMS structures with focus on Inertial or environmental sensors, developing new algorithms for design optimization and improve simulation methods, in close cooperation with project management and technology development. Manage multiple projects under tight time constraints.
Ad hoc requests related to functional or regional activities.

Fluency in English/ Italy.

Experience using Google Sheets, Docs and Slides.
Advanced Excel skills.
Strong interpersonal skills.
High level of integrity and trust

ACCA qualification / or being in the process
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).
Strong Knowledge of IFRS, US GAAP and local tax regulations.
Experience in the FMCG or liquor industry.

Ambizione, nel perseguire grandi obiettivi e nell'investire sul miglioramento continuo

Your tasks
The position could be based in London, Cologne, Hamburg, Milan or Paris, depending on the candidate.

You will bring a wealth of knowledge and expertise in business intelligence, data analysis, contributing to an efficient sales strategy development. You will lead the charge in providing strategic insights, forecasting accuracy, and actionable recommendations to drive sales performance and revenue growth.
Strategic Data Analysis and Reporting:

Lead the collection, organisation, analysis, and interpretation of sales/turnover/revenue data from multiple sources including CRM systems, sales reports to uncover trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Develop and maintain sophisticated sales dashboards and reports, providing actionable insights to senior leadership and key stakeholders.
Drive the development and implementation of advanced analytical techniques to enhance sales performance tracking and reporting.

Performance Metrics: Develop and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) and sales metrics to track sales performance, productivity, and effectiveness. Monitor performance against targets and benchmarks and provide regular reports and updates to sales management.

Sales Process Optimisation: Identify areas for improvement and efficiency gains within our sales process. Work with sales and Ad Operations teams to streamline processes, automate workflows, and implement best practices to enhance sales productivity and effectiveness.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, marketing, finance, supply and product, to align sales initiatives with overall business objectives. Provide analytical support for strategic initiatives and product launches.

Collaborate with the IT team to ensure seamless integration and optimisation of Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system with other sales tools and our IT infrastructure. This includes data synchronization, customizations, and automation to streamline sales processes and improve data accuracy.
Forecasting and Planning Leadership:
Spearhead the sales forecasting process, planning, collaborating closely with sales management to develop accurate forecasts and revenue projections.
Utilize advanced statistical modelling and predictive analytics to forecast future sales performance and market trends.
Provide strategic guidance and recommendations to senior leadership based on data-driven insights and analysis.
Business Intelligence Tools Optimization:
Lead the optimization and utilization of business intelligence tools and systems within the sales organization, ensuring maximum efficiency and effectiveness.
Champion initiatives to enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting processes, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and methodologies.
Serve as a subject matter expert on sales data analytics tools and platforms, providing training and support to team members as needed.
Competitive Intelligence and Market Analysis:
Conduct in-depth analysis of competitor activity, market trends, and customer behaviour to identify opportunities for growth and differentiation.
Deliver strategic insights and recommendations to sales and marketing teams to capitalize on market opportunities and mitigate competitive threats.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute targeted strategies to maintain a competitive edge in the market.
Cross-functional Leadership and Collaboration:
Act as a key liaison between the sales organization and other departments, fostering collaboration and alignment on sales performance metrics and objectives.
Lead cross-functional projects and initiatives to drive continuous improvement in sales processes, systems, and performance metrics.
Mentor and coach junior members of the sales analytics team, sharing best practices and fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making.
Your profile
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Statistics, or related field. Advanced degree preferred.
5+ years of experience in a senior business intelligence or analytics role, preferably within a sales or revenue-focused function.
Expertise in data analysis tools and platforms (e.g., Microsoft Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI) with a proven track record of applying advanced analytical techniques.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to synthesize complex data sets into actionable insights, KPIs and recommendations.
Strong leadership and project management skills, with the ability to drive initiatives from conception to execution in a cross-functional environment.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Deep and strategic understanding of sales processes, CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce), and sales performance metrics.
Proven ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
Detail-oriented with strong organisational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Your team
Join our esteemed sales team in the capacity of Senior Sales Business Intelligence Analyst.
About us
At RTL AdAlliance, we create simplicity for advertisers & value for publishers.

Our fundamental goal is to unite premium content publishers to facilitate connections between international and local brands and European audiences. With offices in 10 European countries and in the US, we exclusively represent only the best video publishers such as RTL, M6, ITV or Activision Blizzard. As part of RTL Group, we offer our clients the latest exclusive insights, advertising technology and services they need to master the total video space and make the very best of the transition into digital and addressable TV.
Do you find inspiration in the international and entrepreneurial spirit of our company? Do you want to actively navigate the advertising industry changes and be a driving force for innovation?
Then we invite you to join us as we shape Europe's leading advertising sales house.

Euronext Clearing is Euronext's multi-asset clearing house. It is the CCP of choice for Euronext’s cash, financial and commodity derivatives markets across Europe, offering a harmonised clearing framework across Euronext venues.

Euronext Clearing offers clearing services for cash products (equities, ETFs, structured products, warrants and bonds) on Euronext’s cash markets in Amsterdam, Brussels, Dublin, Lisbon, Milan and Paris, on Italian equity derivatives and fixed income markets, and on repos on Italian government bonds. It will soon also offer clearing for Euronext listed commodity derivatives (MATIF) and financial derivatives on Euronext Amsterdam, Brussels, Lisbon, Oslo and Paris. Euronext Clearing ensures the efficient and safe functioning of the markets it serves through the mitigation of counterparty risk and the provision of a robust risk management. It is committed to contributing to the protection of its members and their clients across multiple jurisdictions in Europe, providing best-in-class CCP services for trades on financial instruments admitted to trading on the regulated markets and MTFs it clears and delivering its services in an equitable, transparent and non-discriminatory manner.
Euronext Clearing provides a job opportunity as Credit Risk Analyst.
Key Responsibilities

The Credit Risk Team, part of the Risk Management Department, is in charge of the credit-risk controls executed in the admission process to the Clearing and Guarantee System managed by Euronext Clearing, monitoring of Clearing Members’ creditworthiness after the admission and development of Due Diligence framework to properly monitor Clearing Members’ risk-driven indicators that can impact the soundness of financial markets.
The Applicant taking on Credit Risk role will be accountable for the following activities:

Active participation to the admissions process of new Participants to the Clearing System and membership profiles’ changes, aimed at evaluating the fulfilment of the CCP Rulebook and Credit Risk standards
Monitoring the maintenance of membership requirements according to timelines established by Euronext Clearing’s Rules and Regulations
Data Analysis activities for the provision of figures and data regarding CCP membership structure
Enhancement of Credit-risk controls performed on CCP members
Design, development and implementation of Due Diligence questionnaire, in line with international best practices

Interaction in a multi-cultural fast-paced environment in line with European exposure of the Euronext Group that covers different European Markets (Amsterdam, Brussels, Dublin, Lisbon, Milan, Paris, Oslo).
Additionally, the abovementioned role will be also involved in the following activities:
Participation to Euronext Clearing transformation project from Italian CCP to pan-European CCP

Enhancement of the Customer Analytics by means of the definition of dedicated KPIs and the creation of Robotic Process Automations to manage Credit Risk data archives, enhancement of the Credit Risk evaluation and clients’ account management
Enhancement of the Credit Risk model in line with market practice and the new Regulatory Framework of Euronext Clearing, in cooperation with the Risk Management Department
Conducting inspections and audit process on-site at Clearing Member’s premises, according to the timelines established by Euronext Clearing regulations
Enhancement of the set of compliance checks (KYC – Know Your Client and Anti Financial Crime) on the customer base.
Candidate Profile
The ideal candidate has:
Master degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics
Knowledge of Credit Risk Management
Very Good knowledge of programming languages (e.g. Python, Matlab, VB, Java, C++,…) and Microsoft Office Package
Knowledge of Data Analytics and Data Management
Problem-solving attitude, flexibility to cover shifts and out-of-the-box thinking
Team working attitude
Fluency in both spoken and written English
Between 0-2 years working experience
(preferred) previous experience banking/investment banking or consulting firms.

Rentokil Initial è il maggior fornitore al mondo di servizi per le aziende.

Da oltre 90 anni l’azienda si occupa di Pest Control e Hygiene Services. Attiva in oltre 90 Paesi nel mondo – in Europa, Asia, Oceania, America e Africa – conta più di 57.000 dipendenti e un fatturato annuo di £ 3.5 miliardi.
Rentokil Initial Italia offre i punti di forza e l'esperienza di una organizzazione multi-nazionale, pur mantenendo l'agilità e le caratteristiche di una società locale.

L'attività è focalizzata sulla fornitura di un ottimo servizio alla sua vasta gamma di clienti. La filiale italiana opera oggi con due divisioni: Initial Hygiene, specializzata in servizi per l’igiene, che si è ampliata grazie all’acquisizione di CWS-boco Italia, e Rentokil Pest Control, che nel 2021 si è ampliata grazie all'acquisizione di Gico Systems, dedicata ai servizi per la disinfestazione e monitoraggio degli infestanti.
Lo staff è composto ora da circa 650 dipendenti, che assicurano la copertura del servizio su tutto il territorio nazionale agli oltre 28.000 clienti.
Descrizione del lavoro

Rentokil Initial Italia è alla ricerca di un/una brillante Data Analyst a riporto diretto del nostro  Service Excellence Manager della Business Unit Hygiene, e che supporterà nelle analisi e  all'interpretazione dei dati finalizzate al miglioramento delle performance e della qualità del  servizio Rentokil Initial Italia.

YES?! So do we! At Corsearch, there’s no pushing trademark solutions and brand protection from our thoughts. We’re thinking about coined trademarks in the car, a detailed design search over lunch, counterfeits while sitting with the in-laws, and anti-piracy while working out

We are a mission-led company, driven by a passion for making the world better and safer for our brand customers and their consumers. It’s what we do. And people come to Corsearch to be challenged, developed, supported, and valued
The Role
In this role, you will report to the Brand Protection Client Delivery Manager.

You will work closely with the Client Delivery Manager and collaborate with your colleagues to provide one of our largest and most advanced customers with strategic support in protecting its world-famous brands online.

Together with various brand owners, you will be working towards a safe online environment in which the goal is to get rid of all IP infringements that take place around the world. By doing so, you will also make sure that creativity is rewarded, and consumers are protected from illegal and dangerous products.

Counterfeits are commonly sold by organized criminal networks that are often linked to terrorism and human trafficking, which means that you can have a positive global impact while working with colleagues who come from all over the world.
Responsibilities and Duties

Monitor and analyse online content from platforms (e.g. marketplaces, social media sites), websites, app stores, search engines, etc. for infringements in violation of clients’ intellectual property rights and in relation to wider impersonation matters
Carry out online enforcement for the protection of clients’ intellectual property rights by reporting infringing online content to platforms, Internet intermediaries, and other third parties
Conduct status checking for enforced online content and collaborate with Client Delivery Specialists for the escalation of takedown requests
Supervised by Client Managers, with Client Delivery Specialist’s support, handle pushbacks from platforms, Internet intermediaries, and other third parties
Escalate pushbacks from reported infringers to Client Managers

Supervised by Client Delivery Managers, collaborate with Client Delivery Specialists for the development of relationships with platforms, Internet intermediaries, and other third parties to improve compliance and efficiency in dealing with takedown requests
Maintain accurate enforcement records and data

Collect, collate, research, and analyse data from a diverse range of sources, including Corsearch systems and products (e.g. Talisman and scraper tools), to identify infringement trends and develop enforcement strategies/countermeasures
Provide clients with insights into the scale of the infringement landscape and make countermeasure recommendations by producing client presentations when requested
Whenever necessary, support Client Delivery Specialists with client enquiries (e.g. enforcement), conducting research and composing client reports
Attend and participate in client meetings

Contribute to the enrichment of the collective knowledge pool of the team and keep knowledge current by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications and online resources, and providing team members with training and insights
Contribute to the development of work procedures for improving the efficiency of the infringement monitoring/enforcement processes and the efficacy of operational workflows
Contribute to the design and development of Corsearch systems and products by suggesting ideas for automation, enhanced visualisation, and data presentation
Essential
Strong interest in online brand protection and/or intellectual property

Excellent interpersonal, communication, and customer service skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively with others and experience of working remotely with other team members in locations around the world
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to a strategic approach to tackling challenges
Strong data analytical skills, with a keen eye for detail and the ability to process large volume of statistical and qualitative data
Strong organisational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritise tasks and projects while meeting the expectations and deadlines
Detail-oriented, driven to deliver high-quality client services
Understanding of regulatory laws and marketplace policies for controlled substances is a plus.
Hardworking and self-motivated individual, with a proactive and can-do attitude, who is comfortable to have a high degree of ownership in their work from day one and is always willing to learn
Energetic and flexible, with the ability to work in a fast-growing, agile, adaptable environment
Bring a positive and optimistic attitude to your day-to-day work with colleagues
Strong verbal and written English
Tech savvy, with strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and Internet tools (such as browser extension tools and OSINTs)
Client-facing experience is desirable, including prior experience handling customer enquiries and delivering client presentations

In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We move trucks with courage and the power of data to unlock endless and sustainable capacity at exceptional quality. Get to know us better by reviewing our ""\*\* \*\*"" presentation.   We are a growing team looking for a Pricing Analyst in the Pricing department to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. The role is located in our Milan office.   WHAT YOU WILL DO …   The pricing team is essential in shaping and implementing pricing strategies tailored to the Italian market to enhance profitability and competitiveness. Our mission is to deliver optimal pricing through rigorous analysis, innovative product development, and strategic process improvements. The team is responsible for crafting pricing strategies, ensuring their implementation, and continuously monitoring performance.   As a Pricing Analyst, you will play a crucial role in shaping and executing pricing strategies specifically for the Italian market. You will collaborate closely with Operations, Procurement, and Sales teams to ensure that pricing strategies align with market demands and company goals, while maintaining compliance and operational efficiency.   As our business continues to grow, we seek individuals with strong problem-solving and project management skills who can support our teams and navigate the complexities of our evolving needs. If you're resilient, adaptable, and passionate about driving pricing excellence, this role is for you.    In this role, you will:

Data-Driven Insight: Dive deep into data, identify opportunities for improvement, and present data-driven recommendations to stakeholders. Maintain and optimize data models, create BI dashboards, and use advanced analytics to support the Pricing Team’s objectives.

Strategic Execution: Develop and execute pricing strategies that enhance profitability and competitiveness within the Italian market. Monitor and analyze pricing performance, making necessary adjustments to meet profitability targets.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Operations, Sales, and Procurement teams to ensure pricing strategies align with market demands and comply with local regulations and company policies. Act as a liaison between the pricing team and other departments to ensure strategic alignment.
Market and Competitive Analysis: Conduct thorough market and competitor analyses to identify opportunities and threats. Adjust pricing models in response to market conditions and competitive actions.

Operational Support: Be resourceful and adaptable, supporting various initiatives across the business by working with cross-functional stakeholders. Support pricing planning processes by providing clear insights into historical and forecasted pricing performance.
Empowering Teams: Passionately democratize data and empower your team by providing actionable insights and fostering collaboration across the organization.

Innovation and Improvement: Identify and leverage external data sources to enhance understanding of sennder’s performance and market trends. Continuously seek and implement improvements in pricing processes and analytics.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
A graduate degree in Business, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics, or another quantitative field is required

10,Italy,https://it.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=d563d8da9eb93103&bb=oWrMr09SjNX6DnATkRCVZX0KT30IlJ7bfWeLWdrOcvnRNRNDOvmPAi8fk8BtRqX_34qqjiJBAHi_fsiYQ9y5mfu8qjY-J9zz6Tk4r4gaLZbmVjtDx9HJ41p2MqUxaXV-&xkcb=SoCI67M37LFU7eTZpp0AbzkdCdPP&fccid=8179e5bf3b5be631&vjs=3,Data+Analyst,"Milano, Lombardia",Junior Cybersecurity Governance Analyst,Intesa Sanpaolo Group,"Milano, Lombardia",Not available,"Intesa Sanpaolo è un gruppo bancario internazionale, leader in Italia e fra i primi 5 gruppi dell'area euro con oltre 20 milioni di clienti in Italia e all’estero. Estremamente innovativo è anche motore di crescita sostenibile e inclusiva, con impatto concreto sulla società e con un forte impegno per l’ambiente.
Scopo e Attività

Cerchiamo risorse con competenze e interesse nell’ambito della funzione di Cybersecurity e Business Continuity Strategy and Group Governance che si occupa di definire e governare la strategia di cybersecurity del Gruppo sulla base dei principali scenari di rischio e gestisce ed implementa le misure a garanzia della continuità del business in caso di eventi critici.

In particolare stiamo ricercando delle risorse junior che operino nell’ambito del governo e gestione della sicurezza delle Terze Parti e nell’acquisizione, mantenimento ed estensione delle certificazioni di sicurezza informatica e di business continuity, in grado di individuare soluzioni efficaci in logica di priorità, garantendo un approccio challenging alle sfide e riuscendo a sviluppare sinergie e senso di inclusione.
La persona individuata si occuperà delle seguenti attività:
analizzare e valutare i presidi di Cybersecurity e di Business Continuity dei fornitori e del loro security rating
verificare il rispetto delle clausole contrattuali di sicurezza e analizzare gli impatti causati ad Intesa Sanpaolo da terze parti a seguito di eventi/incidenti cyber

svolgere attività di controllo trasversali sui fornitori basate su framework NIST/ISO27001/SOC1, SOC2 e, in generale, elaborare e realizzare la reportistica di sintesi in merito alle attività svolte, sia nell’ambito della Capogruppo sia delle diverse realtà del Gruppo

governare le attività di assessment in ambito Cybersecurity rispetto agli standard di certificazione adottati ISO 27001 e sue estensioni (es.: ISO27017, ISO27108, ISO 27701), ISO 22301, Swift CSP, e gli altri schemi di certificazione attualmente conseguiti dal Gruppo, definendo una situazione “as is” rispetto agli standard sopra indicati

produrre e mantenere tutta la documentazione necessaria a supporto di un Sistema di Gestione della Sicurezza delle Informazioni (ISMS), garantendo inoltre l’efficacia del processo di miglioramento continuo e la redazione della reportistica relativa ai risultati dei singoli interventi
eseguire interventi periodici di follow-up in collaborazione con le strutture coinvolte, per monitorare i piani di remediation.
Esperienza Richiesta
Almeno 1-2 anni di esperienza in ambito Cybersecurity e/o Business Continuity
Qualifiche Richieste, Skills e Competenze

Conoscenza dei framework di riferimento (ad es. NIST Cybersecurity, ISO 27001, ISO 22301, Swift CSP, ecc.) e delle normative (ad es. L.133 sul perimetro di sicurezza nazionale cibernetica, Circolare 285, Direttiva NIS, PSD2, DORA, ecc.) di cybersecurity e business continuity, con esperienze di adozione
Competenze tecniche sulle principali soluzioni e tecnologie in ambito Cybersecurity (es. protezione delle infrastrutture, monitoraggio dei livelli di sicurezza, data security, IoT, cifratura)
Esperienze in ambito di progetti/attività in ambito cyber per la realizzazione di soluzioni di cybersecurity e/o business continuity, on premise, cloud based ed ibride
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Ottima conoscenza e padronanza del pacchetto Office (Word, PowerPoint ed Excel)
Costituisce titolo preferenziale il conseguimento di certificazioni in ambito Cybersecurity quali ad esempio: CISM, CISSP, ISO 27001 , ISO 22301, CSX Fundamentals, NIST, COBIT
Entra a far parte di una realtà internazionale e innovativa. Il futuro non si aspetta, si sceglie!

We are building the best way to buy and sell cars online. With AUTO1.com we offer our professional B2B car trading partners (our merchants) The state-of-the-art platform to efficiently buy and sell used cars across Europe.  Descrizione del lavoro

The Business Analytics department is crucial to drive strategic initiatives, providing leadership with critical data insights and comprehensive reporting. We are looking for a Business Analyst with a good attention to details and an understanding of business principles. In this role, you will use data to assist the decision-making processes, support project execution, and share insights across different levels of the organization.  Qualifiche
As a Business Analyst, you will:
Assist in developing and maintaining data models and reporting systems to support business decision-making
Conduct analysis of business performance, identifying trends, patterns, and areas for improvement
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support
Seek opportunities to improve data processes and methodologies, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
What we are looking for:
At least 1 year of experience in an analytical role
Enthusiasm for problem solving and deriving meaningful insights using data that will benefit the organization
A background using Google Sheet (or Excel), SQL, and Data Visualization tools (such as Tableau and Looker Studio)
Basic knowledge in Python or R will be considered a plus.
Our offer:
Our fast-paced start-up environment offers plenty of challenges that let you grow personally and gives you the opportunity to have direct impact with everything you do
Your life-work balance is important for us, so you will have the opportunity to work from home up to 2 days a week
Collaboration with international teams and chance to meet amazing people with diverse backgrounds
Full-Time permanent contract from Monday to Friday and flexible working hours.
Informazioni aggiuntive
Hiring process:
CV screening
First call with our Talent Acquisition Team
Remote self-paced test
Interview with the Team Lead of the Business Analytics Team

Finally, if you make it to the end we will invite you to come to our office so you can meet us live, get to know the other team members, and have the opportunity to ask us all the questions you need before you begin your new adventure!
Other two important things to keep in mind:
Don't be scared if you don't match some of the requirements, we are looking for capable and committed people, so we will be happy to evaluate your path within the team together

It is truly important for us to bring in a proactive, dynamic and entrepreneurial resource. We are a young, newly formed, close-knit team and need someone who is ready to roll up their sleeves when needed.
At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant
column2: regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Descrizione dell'azienda
Rentokil Initial è il maggior fornitore al mondo di servizi per le aziende.

Da oltre 90 anni l’azienda si occupa di Pest Control e Hygiene Services. Attiva in oltre 90 Paesi nel mondo – in Europa, Asia, Oceania, America e Africa – conta più di 57.000 dipendenti e un fatturato annuo di £ 3.5 miliardi.
Rentokil Initial Italia offre i punti di forza e l'esperienza di una organizzazione multi-nazionale, pur mantenendo l'agilità e le caratteristiche di una società locale.

L'attività è focalizzata sulla fornitura di un ottimo servizio alla sua vasta gamma di clienti. La filiale italiana opera oggi con due divisioni: Initial Hygiene, specializzata in servizi per l’igiene, che si è ampliata grazie all’acquisizione di CWS-boco Italia, e Rentokil Pest Control, che nel 2021 si è ampliata grazie all'acquisizione di Gico Systems, dedicata ai servizi per la disinfestazione e monitoraggio degli infestanti.
Lo staff è composto ora da circa 650 dipendenti, che assicurano la copertura del servizio su tutto il territorio nazionale agli oltre 28.000 clienti.

Con un fatturato di oltre 35 miliardi di dollari, l’azienda è un business globale che produce alcuni dei brand più amati al mondo: M&M’s®, SNICKERS®, TWIX®, MILKY WAY®, DOVE®, PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, EXTRA®, ORBIT®, 5™, SKITTLES®, UNCLE BEN’S®, and COCOAVIA®. Mars fornisce anche servizi veterinari per la salute degli animali da compagnia, tra cui BANFIELD® Pet Hospitals, Blue Pearl®, VCA® e Pet Partners. Con quartier generale a McLean, in Virginia (USA), Mars è presente in più di 80 paesi. I Cinque Principi di Mars – Qualità, Responsabilità, Mutualità, Efficienza e Libertà – ispirano ogni giorno gli oltre 100.000 Associati nella creazione di valore per tutti i partner e stimolare una crescita di cui poter andare fieri. Per maggiori informazioni su Mars, visitaci su www.mars.com. Seguici su Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram e YouTube.    Business Analyst Internship:  Una preziosa opportunità per vivere appieno la cultura unica della nostra multinazionale e per dimostrare di poter diventare futuri Associati.   Vivere un’esperienza di stage con noi significa ricevere una formazione continua “sul campo” e gestire il progetto formativo assegnato con alti livelli di autonomia e responsabilità.    Job Description:  Il tirocinante sarà inserito nel Team Category, come Business Analyst Stagiaire, per la divisione Confectionery.   L’inserimento all’interno del Category permetterà di entrare in contatto con l’organizzazione di una realtà multinazionale all’interno di una funzione centrale: il tirocinante si relazionerà con interlocutori di diverse aree (Sales, Marketing, Customer Service, Logistica) e avrà l’opportunità di comprendere il contesto di business all’interno dei diversi canali in cui l’azienda opera e di lavorare su diversi segmenti di mercato (Cioccolato, Gomme, Gelati, Caramelle).   Le principali attività su cui verterà il progetto di stage riguarderanno:

Fornire supporto tecnico e analitico al team nella creazione e nella gestione dei tools per il monitoraggio delle performance delle diverse categorie e dei principali brand (M&M’s, Snickers, Twix, Bounty, Mars), con approfondimenti sia per la parte sell-in che sell-out e con forte focus sulle perdormance distributive nei diversi canali Grocery, Hard Discount e Impulso.

Fornire supporto nella valutazione e nell’analisi di una ampia gamma di dati relativi a marketing, vendite e consumatori, consolidando il proprio expertise analitico grazie all’utilizzo di molteplici banche dati, fornite da diversi provider e all’analisi di un ampio set di KPI analitici.
Supportare il mantenimento, la codifica e gestione delle principali fonti dati e di gestire la relazione con i data provider partner.
Realizzare business report per le presentazioni trade in vista di meeting con i clienti e con il management.
Gestire progetti ad hoc sui diversi perimetri.
Requisiti e caratteristiche richiesti:
Laurea specialistica o Master
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese e dei principali sistemi informatici
Capacità di analisi e pianificazione
Orientamento al risultato
Capacità di comunicazione e relazione
Autonomia e teamwork

Durata e facilitazioni previste:  Lo stage avrà una durata di sei/nove mesi full-time. E’ previsto un rimborso spese + ticket restaurant giornalieri + rimborso mensile delle metropolitana.   Il presente annuncio si rivolge a candidati di ambo i sessi (L. 903/77). I candidati potranno inviare la propria candidatura all’indirizzo mars.selezione@effem.com, rilasciando specifica autorizzazione ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento dell’Unione europea 679/2016 (di seguito “GDPR”) al trattamento dei dati personali.   Mars è un datore di lavoro che offre pari opportunità e tutti i candidati in linea con il profilo richiesto saranno presi in considerazione, senza alcuna discriminazione per razza, colore, religione, sesso, orientamento sessuale, identità di genere, nazionalità, disabilità, o qualsiasi altra categoria protetta dalla legge.   Mars Italia SpA offre un ambiente giovane, internazionale, informale, altamente meritocratico, con poche gerarchie. Entrare a far parte della nostra Corporation rappresenta un’esperienza unica e una brillante opportunità professionale. Diventare Associati Mars significa avere tutto il supporto, la libertà e la responsabilità necessari per fare la differenza. Ma significa anche essere artefici del proprio destino. Laura in discipline STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics).

Informazioni  Come Senior Data Specialist verrai inserito all’interno del team di Data Science & Data Analysis, a diretto riporto dell’Head of Data Science & AI, in stretta collaborazione con il team di data engineering e con tutte le aree di business di REVO. Ti immergerai in un ambiente flessibile, fortemente collaborativo e dinamico nello svolgimento delle attività, interfacciandoti con il team a Verona nonché a Milano, prevedendo attività anche in trasferta. Siamo un team giovane, competente e ambizioso, ricco di energia e spirito d'impresa. Uniamo passione e competenza, realizzando soluzioni analitiche di enorme impatto all’interno dell’azienda. I nostri prodotti vengono utilizzati quotidianamente per prendere decisioni, risolvere inefficienze, innovare lo status quo dei processi di business, aprendo la strada ad un modo diverso di fare assicurazione. Siamo alla ricerca di brillanti laureati discipline STEM con una solida esperienza di 3-4 anni nell'utilizzo di Python per lo sviluppo di soluzioni software e analitiche, in grado di gestire l’intero ciclo di vita della realizzazione del prodotto analitico, dal prototipo alla messa in produzione. Il candidato ideale possiede un ottimo track record maturato nella creazione e sviluppo di soluzioni di data science e dashboard analitiche, ed è in grado di operare con elevata autonomia in tutte le fasi progettuali.
Aree di responsabilità

In qualità di Senior Data Specialist, la tua figura professionale rappresenterà un perfetto equilibrio tra le competenze analitiche di un data analyst e l'acume tecnico di un data scientist. Avrai la responsabilità di disegnare dashboard intuitive per una rappresentazione visiva dei dati che faciliti processi decisionali informati, unendo la precisione dell'analisi alla potenza della visualizzazione. Parallelamente, la tua esperienza nell’ambito data science & AI sarà fondamentale nel costruire modelli predittivi e sistemi intelligenti in grado di migliorare e automatizzare i processi aziendali.
Esperienze lavorative
Eesperienza di 3-4 anni nell'utilizzo di Python per lo sviluppo di soluzioni software e analitiche
Requisiti tecnici

Conoscenza approfondita ed esperienza in contesto professionale di almeno 3-4 anni nell’utilizzo del linguaggio Python. Nello specifico: creazione di moduli e pacchetti, programmazione orientata agli oggetti e definizione e scrittura di test unitari.

Conoscenza approfondita ed esperienza in contesto professionale di almeno 3-4 anni nell’utilizzo delle principali librerie Python orientate alla visualizzazione, all’accesso, alla manipolazione e in generale all’analisi dei dati. Nello specifico: Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Scikit-learn, Statsmodels, SQLalchemy, Alembic.

Conoscenza approfondita ed esperienza nell’utilizzo di modelli e tecniche di Machine Learning rispetto a problemi di regressione, classificazione, clustering. Padronanza degli algoritmi relativi, quali ad esempio GLM, SVM, Decision tree, RF, XGboost e tecniche di regolarizzazione.
Conoscenza e preferibilmente esperienza concreta nell’utilizzo delle soluzioni e tecniche state-of-the-art in ambito LLM.
Conoscenza del sistema di visualizzazione e dashboarding PowerBI (preferito), e/o tecnologie di reportistica analoghe (Qlik, Tableau)
Conoscenza approfondita ed esperienza concreta nell’utilizzo di database relazionali (PostgreSQL, MySQL) e del linguaggio SQL.
Preferibile esperienza nell’utilizzo dell’architettura Cloud AWS e principali servizi annessi rispetto al comune sviluppo della pipeline di analisi dati (e.g. S3, Lambda, ECR, Athena, EC2)
Preferibile una conoscenza di base di ambienti containerizzati su tecnologia Docker
Modalità di lavoro:

La modalità di lavoro all’interno del team è Agile. Pertanto, è preferibile che tu abbia una esperienza di lavoro basata su tale metodologia e relative cerimonie (Sprint Backlog, Sprint Plan, Sprint Review, Retrospective) e dei principali strumenti per la gestione dell’agile sprint (Jira).

Approccio dinamico con elevata proattività e curiosità
Forte orientamento al risultato
Importante problem solving

We are a growing team looking for a Pricing Analyst in the Pricing department to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. The role is located in our Milan office.
WHAT YOU WILL DO …

The pricing team is essential in shaping and implementing pricing strategies tailored to the Italian market to enhance profitability and competitiveness. Our mission is to deliver optimal pricing through rigorous analysis, innovative product development, and strategic process improvements. The team is responsible for crafting pricing strategies, ensuring their implementation, and continuously monitoring performance.

As a Pricing Analyst, you will play a crucial role in shaping and executing pricing strategies specifically for the Italian market. You will collaborate closely with Operations, Procurement, and Sales teams to ensure that pricing strategies align with market demands and company goals, while maintaining compliance and operational efficiency.

As our business continues to grow, we seek individuals with strong problem-solving and project management skills who can support our teams and navigate the complexities of our evolving needs. If you're resilient, adaptable, and passionate about driving pricing excellence, this role is for you.
In this role, you will:

Data-Driven Insight : Dive deep into data, identify opportunities for improvement, and present data-driven recommendations to stakeholders. Maintain and optimize data models, create BI dashboards, and use advanced analytics to support the Pricing Team's objectives.

Strategic Execution : Develop and execute pricing strategies that enhance profitability and competitiveness within the Italian market. Monitor and analyze pricing performance, making necessary adjustments to meet profitability targets.

Cross-Functional Collaboration : Work closely with Operations, Sales, and Procurement teams to ensure pricing strategies align with market demands and comply with local regulations and company policies. Act as a liaison between the pricing team and other departments to ensure strategic alignment.

Market and Competitive Analysis : Conduct thorough market and competitor analyses to identify opportunities and threats. Adjust pricing models in response to market conditions and competitive actions.

Operational Support : Be resourceful and adaptable, supporting various initiatives across the business by working with cross-functional stakeholders. Support pricing planning processes by providing clear insights into historical and forecasted pricing performance.
Empowering Teams : Passionately democratize data and empower your team by providing actionable insights and fostering collaboration across the organization.

Innovation and Improvement : Identify and leverage external data sources to enhance understanding of sennder's performance and market trends. Continuously seek and implement improvements in pricing processes and analytics.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
A graduate degree in Business, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics, or another quantitative field is required
column2: a Master's degree is preferred.

column1: 3+ years of experience in a quantitative/analytical role, ideally within tech, solutions consulting, or logistics.
Demonstrated experience in developing and executing pricing strategies, particularly within the Italian market or similar regional focus.
Experience working in a pricing department and knowledge of the logistics/transportation industry are pluses.
Strong skills in Excel/Google Sheets, SQL for analyzing and interpreting large datasets to deliver actionable insights. Python/R experience is a plus.
Experience with Business Visualization tools, with LookML experience being a plus.
Familiarity with ETL processes
column2: experience with tools like Fivetran and dbt is advantageous.

column1: Strong analytical skills with the ability to monitor and optimize pricing performance.
Ability to self-serve, investigate, and gather necessary data independently to drive insights and improvements.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to synthesize information quickly, highlight key takeaways, and communicate actionable insights clearly and concisely.
Proven ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration and alignment on strategic goals.

Commuter allowance to assist employees with their daily travel expenses and a one-time home office benefit to ensure that you're properly equipped wherever you work.

Qui nous sommes

Sileron accompagne les entreprises de toutes tailles dans leurs projets de réorganisation, d’innovation et de transition vers le digital. Sileron est reconnu par ses clients en France et à l’étranger pour la mise en place et l’exploitation de solutions innovantes telles que SAP ERP en mode SaaS. Sileron est la marque Cloud de Conseils-Plus, cabinet de conseil en organisation, international basé à Paris. En complément de son activité sur le déploiement des solutions SAP ERP en mode Saas, Sileron déploie également les solutions de Business Intelligence SAP (SAP Analytics Cloud) pour répondre à l’ensemble des problématiques SI rencontrées par ses clients.

Encadrés par des managers confirmés ayant fait leurs preuves dans le monde du conseil, les consultants Sileron vouent leur professionnalisme, leur esprit d’équipe et leur dynamisme à l’accompagnement de leurs clients dès la définition de la stratégie SI et tout au long de sa mise en application.
Forte de sa croissance, Sileron a pour projet de développer sa présence en Italie.

Après un parcours de formation sur les outils et les méthodologies de l’entreprise au siège (Paris), vous participez à la mise en œuvre des fonctionnalités de SAP Analytics Cloud, solution d’EPM (Enterprise Performance Management) en mode SaaS auprès de nos clients.
Encadré par le responsable BI Sileron et le Directeur de la filiale italienne de Sileron, vous êtes le relais de l’expertise BI sur la zone et participez au développement commercial de la solution.
Pourquoi nous pensons que vous pourriez vous intégrer ?
✅ Vous disposez d’un diplôme Bac+4 minimum d’une école d’ingénieur, avec une formation en data science/analyse ou business intelligence.
✅ Vous bénéficiez au minimum d’un stage de 6 mois ou d’une alternance en tant que consultant BI / data analyst
✅ Curieux(se) de travailler avec des opérationnels métiers (ex: direction logistique, équipes financières, etc…), jongler entre compétences fonctionnelles et techniques ne vous fait pas peur
✅ Vous êtes autonome et aimez travailler en équipe
✅ Les sujets BI vous passionnent, de la modélisation de données à la data visualization.
✅ Vous avez déjà eu l’occasion de gérer plusieurs projets en parallèle.
✅ Votre niveau d’anglais est courant, autant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit (votre premier entretien contiendra quelques minutes en anglais). La maîtrise de l’italien est un plus !
Comment vous pourriez vous épanouir ?
Le métier de consultant en Business Intelligence est riche et diversifié. Vous pouvez intervenir dans différentes typologies de projets, ce qui vous permettra d’incarner 3 “rôles” :
Consultant fonctionnel : éclaireur et guide face aux données

De la définition du besoin, à la réalisation d’un plan d’actions, en passant par la réalisation de registres fonctionnels, vous éclairez le client sur ses données en l’aidant à tirer des conclusions pertinentes pour atteindre ses objectifs. Vous agissez comme un guide tout au long du processus décisionnel, lui offrant une vision claire et exploitable de ses données.
Partenaire expert : concrétiser les besoins du client

Lorsque le client a déjà une vision claire de ses besoins vis-à-vis de ses enjeux métiers, vous agissez comme un partenaire expert et technique pour les concrétiser. Vous mettez votre expertise technique au service du client pour garantir la réussite de ses projets.
Innovateur : des solutions packagées pour tous
Vous développez des solutions pré-construites et adaptables, permettant une réponse rapide et efficace à des besoins récurrents pour différents clients.
Concrètement, vos missions peuvent se traduire par:
Accompagner les clients dans l’analyse de leurs données (finance, logistique, notamment via SAP Analytics Cloud) et la création de tableaux de bord et de dashboards pertinents.
Participer à l’ensemble des phases d’un projet BI : recueil des besoins, cadrage, conception, développement, tests et déploiement.
Assurer la qualité des livrables et la satisfaction des clients.
Veiller à la bonne application de la méthodologie du cabinet.
Contribuer à l’innovation et à l’amélioration continue des solutions BI.
Qu'en est-il pour vous ?
Chez Conseils-Plus, “client first”, oui… et “people first”, surtout! Les collaborateurs ont l’occasion de se retrouver plusieurs fois par an dans le cadre de séminaires et moments de cohésion.

Le cabinet met au cœur de ses stratégies le développement de son capital humain. Dès votre arrivée, vous aurez une visibilité claire sur vos perspectives d’évolution, les moyens mis en place pour vous y accompagner et de la place pour réaliser vos aspirations.

Vous nous rejoignez et vous engagez chez nous… nous investissons en vous! Notre package salarial comprend une base fixe annuelle brute entre 38k et 43k selon expérience et des extras (prise en charge 100% des pass transports en commun, tickets-restaurants,, etc..)
Convaincu(e) ? Rencontrons-nous!
Notre processus de recrutement se déroule comme suit

Entretien visio avec notre Talent Partner. Ce sera l’occasion d’apprendre plus amplement à vous connaître, de parcourir plus en détails vos compétences et de vous présenter davantage la raison d’être du poste.

Entretien avec un Consultant Sénior et le Directeur de l’équipe . Entre autres choses, c’est à ce moment-là que vous parlerez davantage des missions précises du poste et de vos compétences. Nous vous transmettrons également notre vision et nos ambitions !

Enfin, vous pourriez être invité(e) à rencontrer un membre de votre future équipe. Moment de partage, vous pourrez échanger avec lui sur son quotidien et obtenir toutes les informations nécessaires pour vous projeter chez nous."
