We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.

Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organisation.
Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!
The Team
Our Global Markets Off-cycle Analyst programme gives our interns maximum exposure to the various products within Sales and Trading.
Programme Overview

Our Global Markets Off Cycle Analyst programme is typically 3-6 months and gives our interns intensive exposure to a single Sales and Trading desk. Interns will work in an exciting and fast paced environment fully supported by their manager, buddy, mentor, and HR.
Training and Development

Your training and development is our top priority with extensive formal training offered at the start of the programme in addition to on the job support, educational speaker events and mentorship throughout.
Responsibilities
As an off-cycle analyst, your key tasks and responsibilities may include but are not limited to:
Sales
Supporting the sales force in their daily activities
Gaining exposure to client relationship management
Preparing marketing material and working on client presentations
Exploring sales leads through market and company research
Delivering analytical projects around client profitability and market trends
Trading
Supporting traders in their daily activities
Shadowing senior members of the team and undertaking mock trading as a hands-on approach to learning the basics of risk management and market making
Analysing client and market data to help develop and execute trades
Following and analysing macro and company specific events as they unfold real time and anticipating the upcoming path and outcome.
Structuring

Supporting senior structurers, traders, and salesforce across GM in their daily activities gaining maximum exposure to all of GM’s clients and products. Activities might include preparing a pitchbook for a client meeting or analysing, designing, and marketing a new client solution.
Gaining front to back exposure of GM transactions, ranging from client relationship management with Sales to risk management and pricing with Trading.

Be part of the analytical engine of GM and deliver projects around topical themes across various asset classes (Equities, Rates, FX, and Credit) by working with other key business stakeholders such as Quants or Research.
Following and analysing macro, markets, and industry specific events as they unfold real time and providing solutions to a diverse set of institutional clients.
Eligibility

Candidates are required to be pursuing either an undergraduate or postgraduate degree from an accredited college or university, with a graduation timeframe between April 2025 and June 2026, or recent graduates for roles starting from September 2025
Achieved minimum of 112 UCAS point (or equivalent) and on track for a minimum 2:1 degree classification (or equivalent)
Must be available to join the programme anytime from January until December 2025
What we are looking for
Essential:
You'll need to demonstrate drive, innovation and a genuine interest in the financial markets
Team-working, leadership and problem-solving skills, plus creativity are key qualities, as is the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, multi-task and interact with a variety of people
You’ll need to demonstrate accountability and productivity and display analytical and problem-solving skills
You’ll need to Influence decisions and outcomes through effective communication and interpersonal skills
You’ll need to promote cooperation and commitment within a team environment to achieve goals and deliverables
You’ll need to demonstrate integrity and ethics by earning other’s trust and respect through consistent honesty and professionalism in all interactions
Desired:
Programming languages/software abilities
For certain roles language skills will be advantageous
Our recruitment process

Analyst internship and full-time recruiting takes place on a rolling basis once our applications are open. Assessments often begin before the deadline, so it’s best to submit your application early as this will give you the best chance of being considered for the role.

We care deeply about shaping the world of work to be an equal and inclusive one – and that starts with our recruitment process. We know just how important and valuable it is to have a wide range of skills, backgrounds and experiences shaping our work and ideas. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, and we’re proud to focus on attracting, retaining and developing diverse talent within Bank of America. Together, we aim to mirror the customers, clients and communities we serve.

We are an equal opportunities employer, and ensure that no applicant is subject to less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, gender identity or gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origins, age, sexual orientation, being pregnant or on maternity leave, socio-economic background, responsibilities for dependants, physical or mental disability. The Bank selects candidates for interview based on their skills, qualifications and experience.
What if I need workplace adjustments?

We’re committed to ensuring our online application process provides an equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. If you need a workplace adjustment to search for a job opening, need help completing your application or video interview, please email juniortalentemea@bofa.com and let us know. We will be more than happy to discuss the support you need, and we will respond to your email within two business days.
We offer a competitive Salary and Benefits package
Application Deadline
October 25 2024"

In the fulfilment centres, millions of items are picked and packed annually, while delivery teams work to get orders to customers on time. Safety is the top priority, and the operations culture is defined by teamwork, diversity, and a shared work ethic that keeps the business running smoothly. The team takes pride in delivering the quality service Amazon is known for globally.    Internship roles are available nationwide:  Corporate offices and fulfillment centers.    Note:  You must have the right to work in the country of employment by the start date.   Key job responsibilities  This internship offers an educational opportunity where you will apply your analytical skills and bias for action to complete an impactful project. This project will support your learning in the Finance Analyst function and contribute to the team's success, ultimately benefiting our customers. Your responsibilities may include:
Gathering data and analysing trends to identify opportunities for cost reduction and improved efficiency
Assisting with financial reporting, auditing, forecasting, and building KPI dashboards to support business unit decision-making.
Conduct financial assessments to support data-driven decision-making and influence final resolutions towards company and customer’s benefit.
Gaining hands-on experience in improving data accuracy and automating tools and processes
Engaging with Amazonians for personal and professional development, and expanding your professional network
About the team    Intern Community:

As an Amazon Intern, you'll be part of a vibrant, supportive community that empowers your growth and development. You'll collaborate with interns from around the world, networking and participating in social events to broaden your perspectives. You can also join specialized groups focused on areas like sustainability to explore your diverse interests.
Amazon Community:
Apart from specific Intern Community, you’ll work closely with people from different backgrounds and stages in professional lives, benefiting from multiple perspectives and experiences.
Support:

The internship program provides a robust support system, including weekly intern office hours, dedicated IT and HR support, and a program team committed to your success. This ensures you have the guidance and assistance needed to thrive.
Learning Sessions:

Exclusive learning sessions will further enhance your skills, granting you access to Amazon's cutting-edge learning platforms and the expertise of industry leaders. These structured development opportunities will prepare you for the next step in your career.
Opportunities:

Upon successful completion of the internship, you may be considered for a graduate role or a second internship, allowing you to continue your journey with Amazon. Additionally, you'll enjoy a competitive monthly salary, relocation support, and access to a range of employee benefits.
Internship Start Dates across the year:
We are hiring interns to start anytime from January through September 2025. Each month, we'll hold 1-2 onboarding days for new hires.
Strong problem-solving, data driven and analytical skills, with the ability to identify process improvements and innovative solutions.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills, able to collaborate effectively with others.
Demonstrated curiosity, proactivity, and willingness to take on challenges in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment.
Be vocal in discussions in favour of the business and the customers, and manage to convince stakeholders.
Data visualization skills, such as proficiency in Tableau, QlikView, PowerPivot, or MicroStrategy
Oracle, VBA and MySQL/SQL knowledge

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates."

Entra a far parte di BIP xTech, il Centro di Eccellenza di BIP specializzato in consulenza e servizi innovativi in ambito Data Analytics, Big Data, Data Science, RPA, Cloud, Blockchain e Networking.

People at the center of our culture
Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialità e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Challenging yourself

Next Steps

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunità future.

column2: quali fonti ritenga utili e affidabili
column3: quali informazioni siano decisive
column4: a quali call to action risponda più frequentemente
column5: e quanto altro ancora sia rilevante in base alle caratteristiche del progetto da promuovere.

column1: Per rinforzare il team di Search Intelligence di FIND, che collabora anche allo sviluppo dell'Osservatorio Search in Italy (se vuoi sapere cosa sia, basta che tu vada sul sito di FIND e scarichi i white paper che trovi in homepage), stiamo cercando un* aspirante Search Data Analyst.
Descrizione del ruolo
Grazie al training che viene fornito come parte dello stage, il/la Search Data Analyst si occupa, in funzione del brief e/o delle indicazioni ricevute (lista non esaustiva)
Di svolgere analisi sui comportamenti di ricerca e di acquisto, al fine di identificare ed evidenziare comportamenti e indicazioni utili, trend, opportunità, criticità...
Di realizzare analisi della concorrenza sia verticale che generale, in uno o più mercati, evidenziando i player consolidati e identificando i nuovi ingressi e gli ""underdog"".
Di produrre forecast e scenari di opportunità.
Di cercare dati di mercato, informazioni, notizie, scenari e quanto altro utile a contestualizzare i dati raccolti.
Con il team di FIND definirà quindi, in base a quanto raccolto e analizzato, gli ""actionables"":
Indicazioni strategiche e operative sui prossimi passi che l'azienda cliente potrebbe portare avanti.
Alert in occasione di situazioni critiche.
Gli output potranno essere in formato PowerPoint, Word o Excel, in lingua italiana o inglese, in base alle necessità e alle richieste dei clienti.
Cosa occorre per candidarsi
Per svolgere al meglio questo ruolo occorre

Curiosità: è un ruolo di analisi, quindi più si è curiosi, meglio è, visto che occorre andare in profondità per trovare gli spunti che possono fare la differenza. Questo è il punto più importante: un approccio superficiale all'incarico comporterà l'immediata interruzione dello stage.
Conoscenza pratica di come funzionino i motori di ricerca e il commercio elettronico (in sostanza il/la candidat* utilizza il Web per informarsi e acquistare).
Ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana parlata e scritta (corretto uso dei tempi e della punteggiatura
column2: attenzione agli errori di battitura
column3: capacità di sintesi...).

column1: Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese parlata e scritta (si deve saper produrre un documento in lingua inglese e saperlo presentare in maniera fluida).
Conoscenza di base di Google Analytics e Google Search Console (frutto anche di partecipazione a corsi e master, a condizione che poi si sia fatta un po' di pratica).
Conoscenza, anche da autodidatta, di tool quali Semrush, SEOzoom, SimilarWeb ed eventuali altri.
Eccellente capacità operativa su Microsoft PowerPoint, Word, Excel.

Buona capacità di espressione e scioltezza nel parlare in pubblico (si può anche non avere questa caratteristica, ma devi mettere in preventivo che dovrai esercitarti parecchio per farci l'abitudine).
Costituiscono elementi preferenziali
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese parlata e scritta (livello madrelingua).
Buona padronanza, a livello scritto e parlato, di un'altra lingua tra tedesco e francese.
La certificazione Google Analytics.
Laurea in scienze economiche o marketing.
Pregressa esperienza pratica (es. altri stage
column2: lavoro in azienda di famiglia
column3: progetti personali...)

column1: Cosa si imparerà
La persona prescelta sarà inserita in un percorso formativo che punterà a fornire nozioni di
strategia
business
digital & performance marketing
search marketing (principi di SEO, SEA)
public speaking
gestione di progetto.
Il/la candidat* sarà inquadrat* nel team di digital analytics ma lavorerà direttamente col/risponderà direttamente al CEO di FIND.
Lo stage prevede una durata di 6 mesi.
La formula è mista fisso (presso la nostra sede di Milano) + remoto. Trattandosi di stage formativo, la presenza in sede almeno 3 giorni a settimana è un requisito fondamentale.
E' previsto un rimborso spese mensile di 600 € + buoni pasto per i giorni di presenza in sede.
Lo stage ha finalità di assunzione. A oggi abbiamo un ""conversion rate"" stage/assunzione superiore al 90%."

Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!

At Sobi, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. We are dedicated to developing and delivering innovative therapies to improve the lives of people who live with a rare disease. Our edge comes from our team of people and our commitment to patients.
Here at Sobi, our mission and culture get us excited to come to work every day, but here are a few more reasons to join our team:
Competitive compensation for your work
Emphasis on work/life balance
Collaborative and team-oriented environment
Opportunities for professional growth
Diversity and Inclusion
Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments
Job Description
Leading and coordinating cross functional interactions between Commercial, Business Units and Finance
Support the Business Unit Director in delivering appropriate sales forecasting, identifying key drivers and assumptions and execute modeling/forecasting as required to enable strategic decisions.
Providing consistent, timely and accurate sales reporting, using systems to efficiently track revenue across country
Leading Iqvia data, Market research data and competitors performance data
Leading the local incentive plan, commitment and cycle plan and coordinating effective communication with the sales leads, local HR and International Commercial operations Lead
Responsible for the delivery and management of the operational tasks and processes, including but not limited to CRM Veeva
Drive continuous improvements, collaborating with Sales and Marketing
Project Management for local and international projects (CRM, BI, Master Data Management)
Managing the tools and the processes for reporting of Sales and Marketing analytics, trend analysis, customer account plan, etc.
Partnering closely with the International
People management
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in business
7+ years of proven experience
Experience with Veeva CRM, BI, Qlik sense
Fluent in English and Italian. Proficiency in both written and verbal communication is essential
Additional Information

All Sobi employees need to demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership. Are you ready to be on the Sobi team? Come join a culture that empowers every person to be the person that makes a difference for rare disease.

Why Join Us?    We are a global company with over 1,700 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.    We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.     Sobi Culture    At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases, and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.    As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

An Equal Opportunity Employer    Sobi is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. All employment decisions at Sobi are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veterans and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status or protected groups by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Sobi is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. Disabled/Veterans. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access this website to apply for a vacancy as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by sending an email to florencia.mendez@sobi.com."

Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills
Being on-track for a United Kingdom 2:1 Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in your undergraduate studies is preferred.

But beyond that, what we’re most interested in are the things that make you, you: the personal qualities, outside interests and achievements beyond academia that demonstrate the kind of person you are and the difference you could bring to the team.
Application deadline: 31st October 2024
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We strongly encourage you to submit your application as early as possible as programs will close once positions are filled.
Join Us

At JPMorgan Chase, we’re creating positive change for the diverse communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career. If you’re passionate, curious and ready to make an impact, we’re looking for you.
What’s Next

Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it’s important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.
After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.

If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you’ll receive an email invitation to complete a video interview, powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.

Completion of the HireVue video interview is required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed it. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete this as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.

ABOUT US    J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation."

#LI-DNI

Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. More information on employment scams is available here ."

16,Italy,https://it.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=f5bcbfefadc19f57&bb=9uFh9lgLMpMUO6FCM2yq9vR89mDRn3BK1dIIEvK5WvFVBOv8B_uKGe5-2lmKkJLimcKKkoB639Q7YGRT636QumaUBq8d4CC7_a9t2IusddFzF_UIhOsjemsIpTypm8cx&xkcb=SoCX67M37LHq3qRUmB0FbzkdCdPP&fccid=02a0954081b525cc&vjs=3,Data+Analyst,"Milano, Lombardia",Data Product Owner (ML/AI),Awin,"Remoto in Milano, Lombardia",Not available,"Purpose of position

Data sits at the heart of the company. This role is to ensure that Awin is able to leverage the data it has access to across the group and build out reporting to ensure we are able to make better commercial decisions and provide best-in-class campaign management to support client facing departments.  As a  Data  Product Owner , is your responsibility able to implement various methodologies of data integration, proactively identify additional data points, data quality issues and improvement potential. You understand data and business requirements and are able to translate into technical requirements and successfully apply your project experience and knowledge to lead data projects in particularly creating new and improving existing Machine Learning models.  You take over the responsibilities of a Business/Data Analyst in a small developer group. Within the role, you are able to break down requirements with clear instructions to your squad team members and ensure stakeholder management.  You have proven communication and analysis skills. You are a strong team player, able to work with minimal supervision and keen to implement and improve our standards and working practices. As a member of Data Services department you will be working with a global team of data engineers and data analysts amongst other big data engineers within the organization.
Key tasks & accountabilities
Collect requirements/requests for any type of data cloud storage solutions enhancement or data project in a structured and focused way
Outline business and technical specification documents in order to translate data projects into action
Manage data/ML projects and oversees engineering work in order to support implementation, remove impediments and escalate across teams and departments, if necessary
Take charge of your team's communication with business stakeholders, ensuring a smooth flow of information and updates
Supervise and enhance the data integration procedures
Be responsible for data quality, accuracy and readiness of ML models in timely fashion for all kinds of reporting purpose
Proactively identify and collect additional sources by reaching out to business identifying gaps to improve our ML solutions
Provide guidance and mentorship to your team, imparting knowledge in data science, data profiling, data models, SQL proficiency, automation and ticket handling and management
Execute analytical experiments to help businesses make decisions across various business units
Work with large datasets to identify trends and patterns to build predictive models
Education & experience
Bachelor degree or higher in Data Science, Data Engineering, Business Intelligence or similar education with focus on Data Science and Analytics
3+ years' experience as Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Engineer or similar
Very strong knowledge of analytics tools and inhouse reporting (Tableau, Power BI)
Experience with Microsoft Azure tech stack (Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Bricks, ADLS, Azure Event Hub, Azure SQL DB)
Strong knowledge of scrum practices and agile mindset
Strong experience with machine learning (ML framework/libraries) and predictive modelling
Strong foundation in statistical procedures for accurate data analysis.
Skills & Core competencies
Very strong understanding of the principles of machine learning
Very strong analytical skills to translate business need into actions with proactive approach to task and challenges
Critical thinking skills
Evangelist to create mind-set to bring new machine learning ideas
Willing to change, learn and start initiatives
Ability to face existing challenges and self-reliant with the courage to take autonomous decisions if needed
Very strong communication and interaction skills with a customer focus
Very strong project and process management competency alongside with time management and prioritization skills.
Our Offer

Flexi-Week and Work-Life Balance:  We prioritize your mental health and well-being, offering you a flexible four-day Flexi-Week at full pay and with no reduction to your annual holiday allowance. We also offer a variety of different paid special leaves.

Working Wherever:  Do you prefer to work from our cool office, from home, or in a completely different environment? With us, the choice is yours. We offer the flexibility to work wherever you want within our Awin locations.
Health & Well-Being:  With our support and access to various initiatives and sports offers, you can devote yourself to your mental and physical well-being.

Development:  We've built our extensive training suite Awin Academy to cover a wide range of skills that nurture you professionally and personally, with trainings conveniently packaged together to support your overall development.
Remote Working:  You will receive a monthly allowance to cover a part of your running costs. In addition, we will support you in setting up your remote workspace appropriately.
Appreciation:  Thank and reward colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer program, and show your appreciation for colleagues who have gone the extra mile to support you.
Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social, and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we've had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual 'Life @ Awin' hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.
Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity
column2: this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships is diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world's leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

column1: Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development."

LA NOSTRA PROPOSTA:

Ti offriamo l’opportunità di lavorare in un  ambiente dinamico , su progetti nazionali ed internazionali, che ti permetta di approfondire continuamente le tue conoscenze e di  sviluppare le tue competenze . La sede di lavoro è  Assago (MI) , ma offriamo la possibilità di aderire all’accordo di  smart working  secondo quanto previsto dalla nostra policy aziendale. Viene comunque richiesta la disponibilità a compiere trasferte sul territorio nazionale e internazionale
Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

I Dati personali raccolti in relazione alla gestione delle domande di assunzione (CV, rapporti di interviste, ecc.) sono trattati da Sopra Steria Group S.p.A. in qualità di titolare del trattamento sulla base dell'interesse legittimo della società a valutare la capacità del candidato di ottenere le posizioni lavorative che potrebbero essere proposte durante la conservazione dei tuoi dati, nonché la necessità di svolgere ogni attività preliminare alla conclusione di un contratto di lavoro.   Le varie categorie di Dati personali raccolti sono:
dati identificativi dei candidati (compresi nome, cognome, fotografia, data di nascita, indirizzo postale, numero di telefono, indirizzo e-mail)
esperienza professionale, formazione, lingue.

Questi Dati Personali possono essere elaborati da personale autorizzato (servizi HR) di Sopra Steria Group S.p.A. e delle imprese del Gruppo Sopra Steria. Se questi destinatari sono tenuti a trattare i tuoi Dati Personali al di fuori dell'Unione Europea, i trasferimenti di dati saranno effettuati in conformità con la legislazione in vigore.   Questi dati personali vengono conservati durante un periodo di 5 anni dopo l'ultimo contatto del richiedente da parte di Sopra Steria Group S.p.A..   Tutte le regole relative ai tuoi dati raccolti in questo modo sono dettagliate nella Carta di protezione dei dati personali (https://www.soprasteria.it/footer/informativa-sulla-privacy).   In conformità con la legislazione / i regolamenti vigenti in materia di tecnologia dell'informazione, documenti e libertà civili, hai diritti di accesso, rettifica, cancellazione, portabilità, limitazione, opposizione e definizione di istruzioni riguardanti la sorte dei tuoi Dati personali dopo la tua morte. Questi diritti saranno esercitati inviando un'e-mail al responsabile della protezione dei dati (DPO) all'indirizzo DPO.Italia@soprasteria.com o per posta a questo indirizzo: Sopra Steria Group S.p.A. - Ufficio legale - Strada 4 Palazzo A7 - 20090 Assago (MI)   Hai anche il diritto di presentare un reclamo Garante per la Protezione dei Dati Personali (Piazza di Monte Citorio n. 121 00186 Roma), se il titolare del trattamento non rispetta gli obblighi previsti dalla legislazione in vigore."

Based at our Corporate Office in Milan, you will support revenue management strategies for 10 luxurious European properties and report to the Area Director of Revenue.    Key Responsibilities:
Report Creation & Analysis: Develop and maintain comprehensive revenue reports using advanced Excel functionalities, including complex formulas, VBA, and Macros.
Data Processing: Gather, clean, and analyze large datasets, including writing and executing SQL queries to extract and manipulate data.
Forecasting: Prepare detailed yield and forecast reports to support strategic decision-making.
Insights Generation: Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations.
Monitoring: Track performance across distribution channels and revenue systems to ensure alignment with business objectives.
Presentation: Present data findings and analyses effectively to stakeholders, ensuring clarity and impact.
Requirements:   Requirements:
Excel Expertise: Demonstrated advanced proficiency in Excel, including strong skills in VBA, Macros, and data manipulation.
Query Skills: Experience with SQL or other query languages for data extraction and analysis.
Analytical Skills: Proven ability to analyze complex data sets, generate actionable insights, and effectively communicate findings.
Relevant Experience: At least 1 year of experience in an analytical role, preferably with a focus on revenue management or similar fields.
Learning Orientation: A strong desire to learn and grow in the field of Revenue Management.
Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with the hotel industry and revenue management systems is a plus.
Language Skills: Fluency in English and Italian with excellent oral and written communication skills.

Benefits:  What We Offer  At Belmond, we pride ourselves on fostering a culture built on kindness, active listening, and genuine connections with our colleagues and guests. We offer a comprehensive range of compensation, perks and benefits including:  Tickets Edenred  Team social events  Complimentary accomodation upon request at Belmond hotels, discounted rates for trains, cruises, safaris and F&B"

Laura in discipline STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics).

Informazioni  Come Senior Data Analyst verrai inserito all’interno del team di Data Science, a diretto riporto dell’Head of Data Science & AI, in stretta collaborazione con il team di data engineering e con tutte le aree di business di REVO. Ti immergerai in un ambiente flessibile, fortemente collaborativo e dinamico nello svolgimento delle attività. Siamo un team giovane, competente e ambizioso, ricco di energia e spirito d'impresa. Uniamo passione e competenza, deliverando soluzioni analitiche di enorme impatto all’interno dell’azienda. I nostri prodotti analitici vengono utilizzati quotidianamente per prendere decisioni, risolvere inefficienze, innovare lo status quo dei processi di business, aprendo la strada ad un modo diverso di fare assicurazione. Siamo alla ricerca di brillanti laureati discipline STEM con una solida esperienza di 3-4 anni nell'utilizzo di Python per lo sviluppo di soluzioni software e analitiche, in grado di gestire l’intero ciclo di vita della realizzazione del prodotto analitico, dal prototipo alla messa in produzione. Il candidato ideale possiede un ottimo track record maturato nella creazione e sviluppo di dashboard analitiche, è in grado di operare con elevata autonomia in tutte le fasi progettuali, e capace di organizzare le attività e di rapportarsi in maniera collaborativa all’interno del team di lavoro.
Aree di responsabilità
Costruire le pipelines di elaborazione dati necessarie per servire e alimentare le dashboard interfacciandosi con i diversi sistemi sorgenti interni o esterni all’azienda.
Definire, progettare e sviluppare dashboards di visualizzazione aziendali in collaborazione con le diverse unità di business tramite strumenti di visualizzazione e tecnologie dedicate.
Interagire con le diverse unità di business, comunicando efficacemente i risultati ottenuti e fornendo in maniera proattiva spunti e suggerimenti.
Esperienze lavorative
Siamo alla ricerca di brillanti laureati discipline STEM con una solida esperienza di 3-4 anni nell'utilizzo di Python
Requisiti tecnici

Conoscenza approfondita ed esperienza in contesto professionale di almeno 3-4 anni nell’utilizzo del linguaggio Python. Nello specifico: creazione di moduli e pacchetti, programmazione orientata agli oggetti e definizione e scrittura di test unitari.

Conoscenza approfondita ed esperienza in contesto professionale di almeno 3-4 anni nell’utilizzo delle principali librerie Python orientate alla visualizzazione, all’accesso, alla manipolazione e in generale all’analisi dei dati. Nello specifico: Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Scikit-learn, Statsmodels, SQLalchemy, Alembic.
Conoscenza del sistema di visualizzazione e dashboarding PowerBI (preferito), e/o tecnologie di reportistica analoghe (Qlik, Tableau)
Conoscenza approfondita ed esperienza concreta nell’utilizzo di database relazionali (PostgreSQL, MySQL)
Conoscenza approfondita ed esperienza concreta nell’utilizzo del linguaggio SQL.
Conoscenza approfondita ed esperienza concreta nell’utilizzo del sistema di versionamento GIT
Esperienza nell’utilizzo dell’architettura Cloud AWS e principali servizi annessi rispetto al comune sviluppo della pipeline di analisi dati (e.g. S3, Lambda, ECR, Athena, EC2)
Preferibile una conoscenza di base di ambienti containerizzati su tecnologia Docker
Preferibile una esperienza di base nello sviluppo software in modalità MLOps o DevOps. Esperienza base nello sviluppo di pipelines CI/CD.
Caratteristiche personali
Spiccato spirito analitico
Forte senso di responsabilità
Approccio dinamico con elevata proattività e curiosità
Forte orientamento al risultato
Importante problem solving
Ottime capacità comunicative e relazionali
Ottima capacità di lavorare efficacemente in team"

Job Description

Leading the local incentive plan, commitment and cycle plan and coordinating effective communication with the sales leads, local HR and International Commercial operations Lead

Drive continuous improvements, collaborating with Sales and Marketing

People management

All Sobi employees need to demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership. Are you ready to be on the Sobi team? Come join a culture that empowers every person to be the person that makes a difference for rare disease.

Why Join Us?    We are a global company with over 1,700 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.    We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.     Sobi Culture    At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases, and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.    As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

An Equal Opportunity Employer    Sobi is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. All employment decisions at Sobi are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veterans and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status or protected groups by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

column2: quali fonti ritenga utili e affidabili
column3: quali informazioni siano decisive
column4: a quali call to action risponda più frequentemente
column5: e quanto altro ancora sia rilevante in base alle caratteristiche del progetto da promuovere.

column1: Per rinforzare il team di Search Intelligence di FIND, che collabora anche allo sviluppo dell'Osservatorio Search in Italy (se vuoi sapere cosa sia, basta che tu vada sul sito di FIND e scarichi i white paper che trovi in homepage), stiamo cercando un* Search Data Analyst.
Descrizione del ruolo
Il/la Search Data Analyst si occupa, in funzione del brief e/o delle indicazioni ricevute (lista non esaustiva)
Di svolgere analisi sui comportamenti di ricerca e di acquisto, al fine di identificare ed evidenziare comportamenti e indicazioni utili, trend, opportunità, criticità...
Di realizzare analisi della concorrenza sia verticale che generale, in uno o più mercati, evidenziando i player consolidati e identificando i nuovi ingressi e gli 'underdog'.
Di produrre forecast e scenari di opportunità.
Di cercare dati di mercato, informazioni, notizie, scenari e quanto altro utile a contestualizzare i dati raccolti.
Con il team di FIND definirà quindi, in base a quanto raccolto e analizzato, gli 'actionables':
Indicazioni strategiche e operative sui prossimi passi che l'azienda cliente potrebbe portare avanti.
Alert in occasione di situazioni critiche.
Gli output potranno essere in formato PowerPoint, Word o Excel, in lingua italiana o inglese, in base alle necessità e alle richieste dei clienti.
Cosa occorre per candidarsi
Per svolgere al meglio questo ruolo occorre

Curiosità: è un ruolo di analisi, quindi più si è curiosi, meglio è, visto che occorre andare in profondità per trovare gli spunti che possono fare la differenza. Questo è il punto più importante: un approccio superficiale all'incarico comporterà l'immediata interruzione del rapporto di lavoro.
Conoscenza pratica di come funzionino i motori di ricerca e il commercio elettronico (in sostanza il/la candidat* utilizza il Web per informarsi e acquistare).
Ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana parlata e scritta (corretto uso dei tempi e della punteggiatura
column2: attenzione agli errori di battitura
column3: capacità di sintesi...).

column1: Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese parlata e scritta (si deve saper produrre un documento in lingua inglese e saperlo presentare in maniera fluida).
Conoscenza e uso di Google Analytics e Google Search Console.
Conoscenza, anche da autodidatta, di tool quali Semrush, SEOzoom, SimilarWeb ed eventuali altri.
Eccellente capacità operativa su Microsoft PowerPoint, Word, Excel.

Buona capacità di espressione e scioltezza nel parlare in pubblico (si può anche non avere questa caratteristica, ma devi mettere in preventivo che dovrai esercitarti parecchio per farci l'abitudine).
Praticità d'uso di strumenti basati su intelligenza artificiale generativa (es. ChatGPT, Gemini, Copilot...)
Costituiscono elementi preferenziali
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese parlata e scritta (livello madrelingua).
Buona padronanza, a livello scritto e parlato, di un'altra lingua tra tedesco e francese.
La certificazione Google Analytics.
Laurea in scienze economiche o marketing.
Il/la candidat* sarà inquadrat* nel team di digital analytics ma lavorerà direttamente col/risponderà direttamente al CEO di FIND.

La formula di lavoro è mista fisso (presso la nostra sede di Milano) + remoto. Il contratto offerto è a tempo indeterminato e l'inquadramento economico sarà allineato all'effettiva esperienza di chi sarà assunto."

Your role

Interested in working in finance, specifically global markets, but not sure where to start? Do you want to work for a firm with a truly global footprint?   We're looking for ambitious students to join our 2025 Off-cycle Internship Program within our Global Markets business.     You’ll get to:
buy and sell financial instruments for our clients
extract market moving data from a variety of sources to inform decisions across our Global Markets business
provide clients with information about recent market trends and offer trades at the best prices
Your team

You’ll be working in our Global Markets business. We advise clients and do everything that’s needed to buy and sell securities for them from start to finish. We work with hedge funds, pension funds, asset managers and family offices to provide coverage, advisory, capital markets and financing services
Your expertise
We’re looking for a candidate who:
is in their penultimate or final year of their degree, or who has recently graduated within six months of starting the internship
has or is on track for a 2.1 (UK grading system) or equivalent in their first undergraduate degree
has values that align with ours: hard-working, trustworthy, dedicated and collaborative
is a strategic thinker with strong communication skills
is motivated to work in a business with high demands and tight deadlines

We’re looking for someone who’s curious and wants to thrive in a business that never stops moving. We welcome all majors, but it’s important to have an interest in the financial industry. We want to see what makes you unique and discover what you can bring to our team. Perhaps you’ve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? Or stepped out of your comfort zone to learn about a subject you found challenging? Let us know how your achievements match the skills we’re after.
Your program

This paid internship will last 3 - 6 months. You’ll work with our experts and learn about the industry, our clients and our firm. You’ll be right at the heart of our business, learning from your colleagues, taking part in day-to-day operations. You'll be given mentors along the way and will have the chance to get to know some of the most senior members of our teams.  You’ll have plenty of opportunities to develop new skills and make contacts along the way. If you like challenges, enjoy learning and want to work where no two days are the same, this program is for you.  If you have a successful internship, you may get an offer to return for our Graduate Talent Program after you've completed your studies.
About us

UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.    With our large and diverse team operating internationally, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Although we all come from different backgrounds and specializations, two things unite us: the conviction that we’re stronger together, and the will and curiosity to constantly improve.
Join us

We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. You’ll get to learn from the best at UBS, inspirational leaders from across the business and experts in everything financial industry. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

Cassa Centrale Banca è Capogruppo dell’omonimo gruppo bancario cui fanno capo altre società attive in ambito finanziario ed in grado di completare l’offerta rivolta alla soddisfazione di molteplici esigenze delle banche clienti.

Cassa Centrale Banca è una “Banca per le banche” che si impegna a lavorare per la rete delle banche affiliate e clienti condividendone valori, cultura, strategie e sistema organizzativo per rendere sempre più efficiente e competitivo il sistema sul mercato. La missione del Gruppo Cassa Centrale è contribuire allo sviluppo della vita economica e sociale dei territori delle banche di credito cooperativo.
Il Gruppo Cassa Centrale ha il proprio headquarter presso la storica sede di Trento, e filiali territoriali nelle maggiori città italiane.
Scopri di più sul sito della corporate http://gruppo.cassacentrale.it/

Al fine di rafforzare il servizio Security & Resilience di Capogruppo, Cassa Centrale Banca sta ricercando un profilo di Business Continuity Analyst da inserire nell’Ufficio Business Resilience.  La missione dell’Ufficio è assicurare la corretta pianificazione, attuazione e presidio dei processi di business resilience, garantendo il corretto allineamento alle normative di riferimento.  Inoltre assicura il coordinamento delle progettualità evolutive di competenza, assicurandone il rispetto delle tempistiche previste e il raggiungimento degli obiettivi prefissati.  Infine garantisce il presidio dei processi di escalation degli eventi critici secondo il modello di gestione delle Crisi di Gruppo.

La risorsa si affiancherà al Responsabile dell’ufficio Business Resilience a cui sarà di supporto e contribuirà ad assicurare l’implementazione delle Linee Guida e delle Policy a livello di Gruppo in tema di Business Resilience, con il contributo delle altre funzioni interessate, acquisendo gradualmente l’autonomia necessaria. La persona si inserirà quindi all’interno di un contesto dinamico e stimolante che lo porterà ad interagire e ad interfacciarsi con i diversi interlocutori della Capogruppo, collaborando con loro per la finalizzazione dei progetti.
Requisiti richiesti:
laurea in discipline economiche / ingegneria gestionale / matematica
preferibile precedente esperienza di 1 - 2 anni in area organizzazione o Cyber Security, e competenze di base in area controlli (risk management, compliance, auditing), nel settore bancario
conoscenze di analisi di processo e degli approcci alla identificazione e gestione del rischio
conoscenza dei principali standard internazionali in materia di Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery (es. LA ISO 22301, CBCP, CBCI) e normative di settore in materia di continuità operativa
conoscenza delle principali normative applicabili (es. Circolare 285, DORA, BCBS Principles for operational resilience), dei principali processi bancari e di funzionamento dei sistemi informativi
buona conoscenza dei sistemi e dei processi IT in ambito bancario (gradita certf. ITIL)
buona conoscenza del pacchetto MS Office e della lingua inglese.
Completano il profilo:
buone capacità analitiche ed organizzative
abilità nell’elaborazione di soluzioni in contesti complessi
orientamento al risultato e disponibilità nella gestione straordinaria delle emergenze
ottime capacità relazionali e comunicative
spiccata propensione al lavoro in team.

column1: Ti occuperai del coordinamento di progetti di evoluzione processi e strumenti a supporto del business aziendale, attraverso l'applicazione e l'utilizzo di metodologie Agile e Scrum.      Perchè Bip?      People at the center of our culture     Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialità e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.     Lavorare in BIP è un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.      Challenge yourself     Avrai la possibilità di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attività e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l’autonomia e la capacità di assumerti responsabilità e metterti in gioco.      Unlocking your potential     Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all’avanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.      Work-life Integration     Troverai una policy che supporta il lavoro AGILE fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.      Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
Valorizziamo l’unicità e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunità di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversità e all’inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrità e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, più ampi.
Promuoviamo l’inserimento e l’integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette – in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 –.

Next Steps     Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente. Se c’è un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all’interno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.     L’iter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner. L’ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.     In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunità future.     Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.      Su di Noi     Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l’esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l’innovazione e la digitalizzazione.     Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze più all’avanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.     Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualità su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.     Crediamo nel valore dell’eccellenza, che è la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse."

17,Italy,https://it.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=23f3e7f8fb8da88a&bb=E3z3VJhRo8Bh5NcrwwWGn8Y-ck1g9yLE4nmvkoLR4O4dF_VCGXI3Bi0rUuqcUZ5yIkR9-jWqSAAz4LU5ggraIMS4bzjiduGAh3mIka0lJ93qPBxo8gY3WuQPo8HOSzMz&xkcb=SoAe67M37LH1GS29mx0GbzkdCdPP&fccid=90e981995229d784&vjs=3,Data+Analyst,"Milano, Lombardia",Business Analyst Senior (Production Planning),Mind the value,"Milano, Lombardia",Not available,"About Mind The Value

Mind The Value is an  international consulting company  that aims to empower businesses to unlock their full potential and achieve sustainable growth through process optimization, system integration, and technology implementation.

Through our expertise  in decision-making, management, and operational excellence , we strive to drive transformative change and create measurable value for our customers. We envision a future where organizations excel by leveraging  innovative strategies, optimized processes, and cutting-edge technologies : digital transformation, Industry 5.0, etc....
We are proud to drive innovation by combining business challenges with result-driven technologies.
At Mind The Value, we believe in making a positive difference by creating unique opportunities for unique talents because  people are at the center  of our strategy.
Join our fast-paced team of dedicated professionals to gain exciting experience in growing, developing, and thriving together.
What we Offer
People First : Mind The Value prioritizes people and values, their well-being and development.
Continuous growth and merit-based career path : Mind The Value provides custom-built training courses for continuous learning in order to ensure personal and professional growth.

International Exposure : The collaboration with international clients, projects, and a multi-cultural teams offers an opportunity to gain valuable experience and a wide range of high-level competencies.
Excellence : Working in a dynamic environment helps develop analytical skills, innovation and problem-solving approaches.
General information:
Industry:  Corporate decision making, management and operational consulting
Business Area:  Production Planning, Quality Management, Plant Maintenance
Years of experience:  4+ years
Degree:  preferred Master’s Degree in Engineering
Employment contract:  Permanent
Headquarter:  Milan, Italy
Role and Responsibilities:

The Senior Business Analyst role will have the opportunity to be involved in international projects for multinational corporation, coordinate team resourses, provide his experience and skills both as  functional competencies  and as  technical competencies  in configuring and implementing different SAP modules (SAP PP, SAP QM, SAP PM, others..) and other technologies (such as MES implementation).
The resource will be assigned to our  Production, Scheduling and Execution Business Unit.

In parallel, the resource is expected to be involved in the business development of the business unit helping the BU leader in creating new offerings, scouting new prospects and evaluating new opportunities.
Working on digital transformation and business process re-engineering projects, you will be involved in the following  main activities :
Process analysis : Collecting and analyzing business requirements to define and implement operating models.

Process redesign : Conducting functional analysis and system customization to support project implementation and development. Reviewing system functionalities based on current configuration and/or technical specifications.
Process automation : Utilizing disruptive technologies such as drones, interconnected solutions, dashboards, big data, and cloud to automate processes and standardize procedures.

Business process optimization : Assisting in the implementation of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) solutions or other technological platforms, ranging from model and process design to implementation.
Creating presentations  to effectively communicate with business references OR stakeholders.
Conducting training sessions  for key users and providing post go-live support.
Qualifications:
Technical and functional skills:
Master's degree in one of the following fields: Management / Energy / Electrical / Mechanical Engineering.
Strong interest in business processes, technology and Industry 5.0
Strong knowledge of SAP PP, SAP QM, SAP PM, SAP WM/EWM and Operations process.
Knowledge of ABAP language or other programming languages is an asset.
Years of experience in SAP project implementation, S4 Hana migration and roll out.
Excellent knowledge of MS Office.
Professional working proficiency level of English is a must.
Soft Skills:
Entrepreneurial mindset: contributing effectively to a growing and innovative environment.
Collaboration and team working skills.
Dynamic, flexible, and proactive approach.
Agile mindset for facing challenges and managing multiple deliverables and projects.
Analytical and result-oriented mindset, producing high-quality output.
Effective communication skills.
Ability to reduce complexity and provide simple and measurable solutions.
At Mind the Value, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all individuals are welcome and valued.
You will be assigned to our Business Unit:  Production, Scheduling and Execution ."

17,Italy,https://it.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=a66d3a8ef09825ab&bb=E3z3VJhRo8Bh5NcrwwWGn4NQQMwBlswOXeSXp6LpbahGa-T6p07FOp7DUJbVzd0RrlcKNWZXmv_eehpC7gCXZ3iRmNWHfDfoffz00oxpzYf2CMKNeH5FWo72FyQzaAw9&xkcb=SoCD67M37LH1GS29mx0FbzkdCdPP&fccid=b97bfc171c647178&vjs=3,Data+Analyst,"Milano, Lombardia",IT & Security Governance Analyst,FinecoBank S.p.A.,Parzialmente remoto in 20131 Milano,Not available,"FinecoBank è una banca multicanale che offre, in un unico conto, servizi di banking, credit, trading e investimento. E’ leader in Europa nel brokerage e dispone di una delle maggiori reti di consulenti finanziari, con un network capillare di Fineco Center in tutta Italia. FinecoBank è una delle più importanti banche FinTech in Europa, oltre ad essere uno dei più importanti player nel Private Banking in Italia, con un approccio consulenziale altamente tailor-made che include servizi fiduciari, di protezione e trasmissione del patrimonio personale e aziendale, consulenza legale e fiscale e gestione degli eventi di discontinuità.
Posizione:
Cerchiamo una brillante e motivata risorsa con profilo Analyst da inserire nel nostro team di ICT & Security Governance.

La risorsa selezionata avrà l'opportunità di crescere professionalmente in un ambiente dinamico e stimolante, collaborando a progetti strategici per l'azienda e contribuendo alla definizione e implementazione di framework e processi in ambito ICT e Security.
Responsabilità principali:

Supporto alle attività di ICT & Security governance: collaborare nella definizione e implementazione di framework e processi di governance ICT & Security, assicurando l'allineamento con le strategie aziendali e le normative vigenti, contribuendo al miglioramento della gestione dei processi IT, quali change management, incident management e problem management.

IT Controls Assurance & Data Analytics: Raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare dati provenienti da diverse fonti (tool di incident/security incident/change management, log, database, etc.) al fine di individuare trend e potenziali rischi ICT e di sicurezza. Valutare il disegno e l'efficacia dei controlli esistenti attraverso l'analisi dei dati e l’identificazione di eventuali anomalie e/o pattern.

Contribuire al miglioramento e all’evoluzione nel continuo dei controlli IT nel rispetto dalla normativa vigente in ambito (es. D.Lgs. 262, 285, EBA guidelines, ecc) e delle best practice/framework di riferimento di settore (es. Cobit, ITIL, ISO).
Attività di reporting: contribuire alla produzione di adeguata reportistica tipicamente verso le funzioni di controllo interne e verso i Regulators.

Gestione della documentazione: contribuire a mantenere aggiornata la documentazione relativa ai processi in ambito ICT &Security inclusi policy, processi, procedure e controlli assicurandone la conformità con normative e standard di settore.
Requisiti:
Laurea: Lauree in discipline scientifico-tecnologiche o esperienza equivalente

Conoscenze tecniche: Buona conoscenza dei principi di IT&security Governance, gradita la conoscenza dei framework ITIL, COBIT e standard ISO 27001. Conoscenza dei processi IT (change, incident, problem management). Certificazione ITIL v4 costituisce un plus. Certificazioni in ambito data analytics (es. Microsoft Power BI) costituiscono un ulteriore plus.

Competenze di data analytics: Capacità di raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare dati provenienti da diverse fonti al fine di individuare anomalie, trend e potenziali rischi per la sicurezza informatica.
Soft skills: Ottime capacità analitiche e di problem solving. Buone capacità comunicative, sia scritte che orali. Propensione al lavoro in team e flessibilità.
Lingua: Ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese (livello B2/C1).
Normativa: Conoscenza della normativa vigente in ambito ICT e cyber, inclusi D.Lgs. 262, 285, EBA Guidelines.
Altre informazioni:
Cosa apprezziamo:
Passione per l'ICT e la Security: interesse per le nuove tecnologie e le tendenze del settore.
Lavoro in team: comprovate capacità di lavorare in team con profili di seniority differente.
Proattività: Capacità di individuare e risolvere problemi in modo autonomo.
Orientamento al risultato: Fiducia nelle proprie capacità e determinazione nel raggiungere gli obiettivi.
Sede di lavoro:  Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

I Dati personali raccolti in relazione alla gestione delle domande di assunzione (CV, rapporti di interviste, ecc.) sono trattati da Sopra Steria Group S.p.A. in qualità di titolare del trattamento sulla base dell'interesse legittimo della società a valutare la capacità del candidato di ottenere le posizioni lavorative che potrebbero essere proposte durante la conservazione dei tuoi dati, nonché la necessità di svolgere ogni attività preliminare alla conclusione di un contratto di lavoro.   Le varie categorie di Dati personali raccolti sono:
dati identificativi dei candidati (compresi nome, cognome, fotografia, data di nascita, indirizzo postale, numero di telefono, indirizzo e-mail)
esperienza professionale, formazione, lingue.

Questi Dati Personali possono essere elaborati da personale autorizzato (servizi HR) di Sopra Steria Group S.p.A. e delle imprese del Gruppo Sopra Steria. Se questi destinatari sono tenuti a trattare i tuoi Dati Personali al di fuori dell'Unione Europea, i trasferimenti di dati saranno effettuati in conformità con la legislazione in vigore.   Questi dati personali vengono conservati durante un periodo di 5 anni dopo l'ultimo contatto del richiedente da parte di Sopra Steria Group S.p.A..   Tutte le regole relative ai tuoi dati raccolti in questo modo sono dettagliate nella Carta di protezione dei dati personali (https://www.soprasteria.it/footer/informativa-sulla-privacy).   In conformità con la legislazione / i regolamenti vigenti in materia di tecnologia dell'informazione, documenti e libertà civili, hai diritti di accesso, rettifica, cancellazione, portabilità, limitazione, opposizione e definizione di istruzioni riguardanti la sorte dei tuoi Dati personali dopo la tua morte. Questi diritti saranno esercitati inviando un'e-mail al responsabile della protezione dei dati (DPO) all'indirizzo DPO.Italia@soprasteria.com o per posta a questo indirizzo: Sopra Steria Group S.p.A. - Ufficio legale - Strada 4 Palazzo A7 - 20090 Assago (MI)   Hai anche il diritto di presentare un reclamo Garante per la Protezione dei Dati Personali (Piazza di Monte Citorio n. 121 00186 Roma), se il titolare del trattamento non rispetta gli obblighi previsti dalla legislazione in vigore."

Interviews  (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). Job description
As a Financial Planning Manager, you will be responsible for analyzing the financial performance of the scope you are assigned and ensure the financial sustainability of its business.
This includes:
Reviewing and monitoring of the monthly P&L of the scope
Providing the analysis required to establish a yearly budget and monitor its gap with the P&L
Providing financial analysis and forecasting
Analyzing the profitability of individual business lines/projects and identifying actions to preserve/improve the business’ margins
Supporting the determination of the variable remuneration of the management
Supporting the production of financial reports to be submitted to the Board of Directors
Overseeing and monitoring the structured projects provisions
Managing cash and monitoring the invoicing flows
Interacting and coordinating with the other finance teams: treasury, controlling, accounting, invoicing, etc. and staff departments: HR, Management and Director
Managing a business controller and potentially junior Financial Planning Analysts
Ideal Profile:
Completed a first successful experience in finance, looking for a challenging next step.
You have or are:
Graduated from a Master's degree
A previous experience between 3-4 years in a similar position (corporate finance, controlling, financial analysis…)
Already an experience of team management
Strong analytical and data gathering skills, with attention to detail
Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint presentations creation abilities along with financial modeling experience
Excellent communication and inter-relationnal skills
