Amaris Consulting  is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.    At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:      Brief Call : Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!      Interviews  (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!      Case study : Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.     As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.   We look forward to meeting you!
Job description

About Us:  At Amaris, we are dedicated to innovation and excellence in our field. We are currently seeking a dynamic and proactive  IT Functional Analyst  to join our team. This is a unique opportunity to work on high-visibility projects and gain exposure at the corporate level. You will join as member of the CoE (Centre Of Excellence) team, composed by more than 90 highly skilled profiles focused on IT governance.

Job Description:  The IT Functional Analyst will play a critical role, gathering requirements and being the link between business and development team that will inform strategic decisions in our banking services division. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of translating complex data into actionable insights and contributing to the success of banking operations.
Key Responsibilities:
Gather and document business requirements from stakeholders to ensure that project objectives align with business strategies.
Analyze and interpret data to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to banking services.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive improvements in processes and systems.
Present findings and recommendations to senior management to inform business strategies.
Translate requirements into suitable language for internal stakeholders
Documentation of requirements from various stakeholders
Ability to draw flowchart and diagrams
Proficient knowledge of Oracle SQL database
Profile Requirements:
Proven experience as a IT Functional Analyst in the banking sector
Ability to analyse financial data, foresee potential challenges, and propose effective solutions.
Understanding of financial decision-making processes and their impact on the system.
Proficiency in understanding and integrating different systems, applications to ensure seamless data flow and process integration.
Skill in eliciting, analysing, and documenting requirements from various stakeholders to ensure that the integrated systems meet business needs and objectives.
Excellent documentation skills to prepare and deliver various documents required in the project.
Proficiency in creating and managing user stories, epics, and acceptance criteria to capture and prioritize requirements.
Strong communication skills to effectively interact with various stakeholders in international context and present information clearly and concisely.
Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Oracle SQL
Nice to have : proven experiences in MiFID regulatory
3 days/week on-site working in Milan
3-6 years of experience as IT Functional Analyst

As we are a Consulting company, and also support our customers at their offices and R&D departments, we ask for flexibility in travelling, a desire to work closely with the customer, and a good amount of face-to-face cooperation.
What we offer?
Youthful and engaging work climate
Lunch vouchers of €8 per workday
Travel reimbursement for travel from client based on distance
East Health insurance fund
Free access to Mantu Academy platform (24/7)
Access to Wellness platform (24/7)
Psychological counseling.
Our ideal candidate recognizes in these values:
Pioneer : Our spirit of entrepreneurial adventure is what brings us all together and leads us to success.
Care : Care is the foundation of all relationships, trust enables us to promote freedom of expression, creativity, and innovation.
Performance : This translates into a constant desire to move forward and never stop asking more of ourselves.
Commitment : We do not just fulfil our commitments and work hard to achieve great results.
Independence : Amaris Consulting belongs to those who created it and to those who develop it every day.

You will join a certified Top Employer that supports its partners cross-sectors 360 degrees on the software lifecycle, providing solutions in different areas such as Strategy management, Data innovation, Business applications & Processes, Design & Development, Digital Workplace and Platform & Security.

Amaris Consulting is an equal opportunity believer. We are committed to promoting all types of diversity within our teams and creating a work environment that is open to all. That is why we encourage eligible candidates to apply, regardless of their gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, creed or religion, marital status, disability, or other characteristics"

19,Italy,https://it.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=ceba3f299b53fcdc&bb=lg-FwVm2fz3mWQ_xA3Oz4neNH9pB-LgTqajartR82SNegiQGeun0s7mSUFxLHZ6G9AkZ-0Iquy6F5JrsQWe2knaNsVMY8gULXeIuSKCpoOWW6SIOTlq4Zg%3D%3D&xkcb=SoDZ67M37LYl-AW9mx0KbzkdCdPP&fccid=bcc74f93a061d5de&vjs=3,Data+Analyst,"Milano, Lombardia",Senior Risk Analyst,ION,"Milano, Lombardia",Not available,"About us:

ION Group is a community of visionary innovators, dedicated to providing pioneering software and consultancy services to financial institutions, trading firms, central banks, governments, and corporations around the world. We strive to simplify the way people work. We do that by providing workflow and process automation software, as well as providing real-time data and business intelligence to help people make better decisions.
We are 10,000+ employees, 35+ global offices, and over 4,800+ customers worldwide.
About the job:

We are seeking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Risk Analyst to join our team. The Risk Analyst will be responsible for identifying, analyzing, and managing risks across the organization in particular ICT and cyber Security Risks. This role requires a solid understanding of risk management principles, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with various departments. Key responsibilities include developing risk management policies, conducting risk assessments, and implementing risk mitigation strategies. The successful candidate will also be responsible for monitoring and reporting on risk exposure, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, and providing training and support to staff on risk management practices. This is a critical role that requires a proactive approach to risk management and the ability to think strategically about potential risks and their impact on the organization.
Your responsibilities:
Provide the overall leadership, vision, and direction for risk management
Provide senior management with all relevant risk-related information to enable them to establish the company's level of risk appetite
Assess the strength and sustainability of the risk strategy and risk appetite and ensure that risk appetite is properly translated into specific risk limits
Establish, maintain and reinforce the Company’s integrated risk management framework and architecture to mitigate the overall risk position and improving risk profile of the Company
Develop and implement risk management policies and guidelines in accordance with relevant regulation(Basel, EBA, Bank of Italy regulations etc) and best practice
Develop and implement tools to support risk management process, also by applying innovative technologies
Regularly monitor the company's actual risk profile and evaluate it against its strategic objectives and risk appetite
Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies and actions plans to reduce or manage identified risks
Identify and analyze emerging risks and recommend strategies to mitigate them
Improve the company’s risk management readiness through communication and training programs
Ensuring continuous improvement in the Risk Management Practices/policies of the company
Your skills, experience, and qualifications:
Master’s degree in quantitative discipline such as Quantitative Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent
3+ years of proven experience within structured companies, from the IT / Banking sector
Excellent knowledge in the field of enterprise risk management and ICT Risk Management
Having ISO31000, ISO27005 and CRISC certifications is a plus
Strong understanding of statistics and quantitative data analysis methods
Excellent relational and problem solving skills, with a strong aptitude for teamworking
Ability to influence a culture of risk awareness in the organization
Fluency in English
What we offer:
A full time, permanent employment contract
An opportunity to grow in the role and within our organization
Important notes:
According to the Italian Law (L.68/99) please note that candidates from the disability list will be given priority. #LI-MC2
€0 - €0 a year"

La Società fornisce servizi di Business Advisory, Information Technology e Digital Engagement. Grazie alla combinazione di competenze specialistiche, tecnologie proprietarie avanzate e un patrimonio di esperienza consolidata, il Gruppo supporta primarie istituzioni finanziarie, assicurative e industriali nelle più importanti sfide della trasformazione digitale. Con circa 2.000 dipendenti e sedi in Italia, Regno Unito, Germania, Austria, Svizzera, Lussemburgo, Spagna, Romania, Repubblica Ceca, Polonia, Albania e Ucraina, nel 2021 il Gruppo ha registrato ricavi per 235,3 milioni di euro.

Be Management Consulting  è la società del Gruppo Be | Shaping the Future che si occupa di Business Advisory. Tra le più riconosciute del settore per la capacità di gestire e supportare le trasformazioni complesse dell’ecosistema dei Financial Services, Be MC si distingue per la sua capacità di calarsi nella realtà dei suoi Clienti mettendo a disposizione competenze specialistiche e capacità nell’orchestrare soluzioni end to end sartoriali. Le nostre persone lavorano in un ambiente dinamico e stimolante, che tiene in grande considerazione la formazione dei singoli e promuove la dedizione, l’accuratezza e la flessibilità nello stare al passo con i continui mutamenti che il contesto lavorativo impone ogni giorno.
Per la sede di Milano stiamo cercando un  Business Analyst  in ambito  Capital Markets Transformation .
DESCRIZIONE

Arricchiamo continuamente il nostro team con consulenti esperti nei diversi ambiti dei Financial Services che abbiano maturato esperienza in realtà strutturate, preferibilmente primarie società di consulenza direzionale.

Cerchiamo professionisti con consolidata expertise nell’Information Technology che abbiano lavorato in ambiti progettuali complessi, risorse orientate all’innovazione e all’evoluzione tecnologica, che sappiano coniugare skills tecniche e leadership individuale.
PERCHÉ SCEGLIEREMO TE?
Hai una Laurea in Ingegneria Matematica e/o Finanziaria, in alternativa Matematica, Informatica o Economia con indirizzo quantitativo
Hai maturato/vuoi maturare esperienze significative nella governance e analisi di progetti innovativi legati all’Area Finance in ambito Capital Markets e/o Risk Management
Possiedi una buona conoscenza delle tematiche relative al Capital Markets: strumenti finanziari, modelli di valutazione, pricing, market data, accounting, risk analysis e processi front to back
Hai una buona conoscenza delle piattaforme Murex oppure Loan IQ
In alternativa, possiedi una buona conoscenza della normativa EMIR
Pregressa esperienza in ambito Project Management e/o Project Management Officer è considerata un plus
Conoscenza dei principali tools usati in ambito project management (JIRA, ServiceNow) è considerata un plus
Se ritieni sia giunto il momento per affrontare nuove sfide e vuoi entrare in un’azienda dinamica, orientata all’innovazione e all’evoluzione tecnologica Be è la società che fa per te!
COSA TI ASPETTA?
Inserit* in un Team giovane e stimolante, sarai coinvolt* in attività di:
IT Project Management ed analisi
Definizione strategie di integrazione ed architetture applicative
Definizione driver di stima, quantificazione e pianificazione trasformazioni
Approfondimenti su analisi funzionali/tecniche propedeutici alla definizione di soluzione di problematiche di progetto
Analisi e sviluppo interfacce di comunicazione tra applicazioni tra sistemi di position keeping Finanza (Murex, Kondor, Sophis) e altre applicazioni della banca
Coinvolgimento nella predisposizione della documentazione funzionale e tecnica di progetto.
COSA TI OFFRIAMO
Tempo Indeterminato
CCNL Metalmeccanici Industria
RAL in relazione all’esperienza effettivamente maturata
Bonus Variabili
Smartworking

In a new business context influenced by factors like the pandemic, supply chain disruptions, surging logistics and energy costs and, last but not least, social changes triggered by the Russia-Ukraine conflict, our clients find themselves forced to radically rethink their development strategy and thoroughly review their production and logistics assets.  Our  Restructuring division  is recruiting specialists for its Turnaround and operational improvement team. Specifically, it is looking to add a  senior professional  in the  Supply chain and Logistics area .  Candidates should have solid experience in managing Operations issues. The right people for this KPMG team will have expertise in cost cutting projects and the streamlining of production sites, the optimisation of supply chain systems (inbound/outbound), warehouse rationalisation and transport optimisation, the reduction of inventories and the improvement of customer service. With these key skills, they will become the point person for leading Italian and international clients.
Specifically, for our  Milan  team we are recruiting a  senior resource  for the supply chain area, who will be tasked with:

managing advisory projects for logistics and distribution at the client's production sites and warehouses, integrating all the involved functions and monitoring the progress of the project and the planned actions

column2: planning the replenishment of supplies and intermodal flows. Scaling warehouses, designing logistics networks and conducting feasibility studies

column1: improving EBITDA and WC by optimising procurement, improving inventory policies, optimising the supply chain, improving industrial processes, managing change, defining the internal logistics process, designing the layout, eliminating redundant activities and allocating resources.

2/4 years of experience in logistics and distribution as a project manager and/or logistics manager for a large company
a specialist degree in engineering
excellent knowledge of English, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad
an excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office

Trasforma insieme a noi.
Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l’esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l’innovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5.000 professionisti, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze più all’avanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.
Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualità su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell’eccellenza, che è la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.
Entrerai in contatto con professionisti esperti che ti guideranno nella realizzazione dei tuoi progetti lavorativi.
Quale sarà la tua sfida?   .

Nella nostra AdB Industrial, Mobility & Automotive, supportiamo i clienti nella definizione della strategia tecnologica e nella sua governance. Applichiamo metodologie e framework di riferimento e ci avvaliamo di professionisti esperti e certificati sulle principali metodologie di mercato: Waterfall, Agile, PMP, TOGAF per analisi e disegno Enterprise Architecture e ITIL per iniziative in ambito IT Governance, progetti ambito analisi di mercato, M&A etc etc…

All’interno della nostra Area di Business avrai la possibilità di occuparti di alcune delle seguenti attività di: PMO, PM, Business Analyst, Vendor Management e Cost Control in progetti internazionali su clienti del settore Automotive e Industrial.

Sarai tu ad entrare nel nostro Team?   Hai l’abilità di pensare “out of the box”, hai voglia di mettere in campo le tue idee e le tue capacità, ti piace lavorare con gli altri, sei una persona determinata e ti appassionano innovazione e tecnologie?
Di seguito puoi approfondire i requisiti e le caratteristiche della persona che stiamo cercando:
Laurea specialistica in Economia, Management o Ingegneria
Passione per il mondo della consulenza
Buone capacità analitiche (studio o esperienze in stage ambito audit, M&A, Accounting - gradite ma non mandatorie)
Esperienza pregressa (anche breve) di stage
Completamento (o prossimo completamento) della Laurea Magistrale
Conoscenza di Excel e Power Point
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Capacità di analisi e creatività, abilità di innovare, curiosità, proattività
column2: Predisposizione a lavorare in team.

column1: Perchè Bip?
People at the center of our culture   Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialità e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.
Lavorare in BIP è un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.

Challenging yourself   Avrai la possibilità di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attività e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l’autonomia e la capacità di assumerti responsabilità e metterti in gioco.
Unlocking your potential   Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all’avanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.
Work-life Integration   Troverai una policy che supporta il lavoro AGILE fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion   Valorizziamo l’unicità e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunità di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.   Il nostro approccio alla diversità e all’inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrità e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, più ampi.   Promuoviamo l’inserimento e l’integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette – in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99

Next Steps   Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.   Se c’è un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all’interno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.   L’iter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.   L’ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.   In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunità future.     Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Tax Advisor
Purpose of the Job:
Tax advisors or analysts are highly detail-oriented professionals who use a strong grasp of mathematics and excellent tax know-how to manage all tax paperwork for the company.

The Tax Function is responsible for all of tax affairs of the group worldwide. Its successful management has a significant impact on net profit, earning per share and cash flow. The objective of the Tax Function is to deliver the highest quality and most business oriented tax services, on a timely manner and in a proactive way.
In line with Finance team, the Tax Advisor or Analyst missions are:
To be the guardian of the rules, ensuring proper compliance with regard to direct and indirect taxes (including in certain countries, the filing of the tax returns and the related payments)
To be a recognized business partner managing the day-by-day tax compliance with good deal of independence and close relationships with business stakeholders and the finance community
To draft accurate tax reporting in relation to the Region (Tax reporting package + Cash tax) for each Group deadline
To Assist in preparing on a timely, accurate and complete basis the annual tax computations, including the tax provision for the statutory accounts
To interact with the finance teams in order to obtain reliable data and information for the tax calculation
To monitor the legislative changes ensuring the internal processes and procedures are properly and consistently arranged
Co-manage (with accounting) Tax audits

To assist in providing tax advisory support to all the business in the Region for tenders implying multi-entity and multinational scope ensuring compliance and optimization of tax matters through tender and project execution phases
Key accountabilities:

The Tax Advisor is a member of the Tax team. She/he will provide tax support in the course of the tender activities while assessing and anticipating the tax impacts of the contemplated projects, based on applicable legislations & regulations of the relevant jurisdictions, and in line with the sector transfer pricing policy. It includes all types of taxes: direct + indirect, local + international.
The tax advisor will further assist during the execution of the project in order to allow smooth implementation of tax recommendations and proper corresponding tax compliance (incl. audits).
The tax advisor shall as well animate/co-animate internal tax training sessions.
Reviewing, assessing and optimizing from a tax standpoint international tenders, contracts and projects in coordination with Operations, Regions and other support functions
Participate to the monitoring of all Sector type of tax issues: cross-border payments, transfer pricing policy in the industry, tax M&A related to projects
Provide support in the course of tax audits of foreign affiliates
Assistance to local finance contacts
Monitor rating for tax risks relating to projects
Educational Requirments Mandatory: Bachelor's degree in Accounting or other degree with equivalent accounting experience
Three - five years of working experience in Multinational Companies, major Auditing Companies or primary Tax Firms
Good knowledge of local and international accounting principles and tax legislation
Fluent English and local language
Competencies & Skills
Strong computer technical skills - MS Excel  Strong organizational skills & attention to detail
Strong math skills to accurately record and transcribe detailed financial information into tax forms
Analytical skills
Strong communication skills - both oral and written
Team-player, customer-centric attitude
Ability to work in an international environment
Ability to work with cross functional teams and proactively seek solutions or suggest improvements

You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!
Important to note
As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

Job Segment:  Accounting, Tax, Finance"

Data Engineer

Siamo alla ricerca di un  Data Engineer  da inserire nel nostro team Data Management, responsabile dello sviluppo di un'ampia gamma di prodotti di dati, dai sistemi scalabili di ingestione/elaborazione dei dati ai progetti di data lake e machine learning.  Come parte del team Data & Analytics, i nostri data engineer lavorano in modo interfunzionale con il reparto IT, i data scientist e gli analyst per supportare gli stakeholder aziendali a guidare l'impatto attraverso un processo decisionale informato.
Responsabilità
Costruire e implementare processi ETL/ELT e di manipolazione dei dati altamente efficienti e scalabili utilizzando tecnologie big data e cloud
Progettare e implementare il data lake per la reportistica e l'analisi self-services
Raccogliere i requisiti dalle parti interessate, compresi i data scientist e gli analisti aziendali
Impostare sistemi di monitoraggio della qualità dei dati che garantiscano che i dati raccolti abbiano la qualità e le caratteristiche richieste
Progettare pipeline CI/CD scalabili per distribuire in produzione prodotti di dati e soluzioni di intelligenza artificiale
Lavorare a stretto contatto con i partner in un ambiente collaborativo per realizzare casi d'uso analitici
Requisiti
Minimo 3 anni di esperienza nel campo dell'ingegneria dei dati lavorando in un contesto agile
Esperienza di sviluppo con Python/Java. La conoscenza di Scala è un plus
Forte conoscenza del database SQL/NoSQL e delle tecniche di modellazione dei dati
Esperienza diretta con le tecnologie Cloud (ad es. Azure, AWS, Google)
Esperienza pregressa nella progettazione e implementazione di soluzioni MLOps e CI/CD

About us:      ION Group is a community of visionary innovators, dedicated to providing pioneering software and consultancy services to financial institutions, trading firms, central banks, governments, and corporations around the world. We strive to simplify the way people work. We do that by providing workflow and process automation software, as well as providing real-time data and business intelligence to help people make better decisions.     We are 10,000+ employees, 35+ global offices, and over 4,800+ customers worldwide.      About the job:      We are seeking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Risk Analyst to join our team. The Risk Analyst will be responsible for identifying, analyzing, and managing risks across the organization in particular ICT and cyber Security Risks. This role requires a solid understanding of risk management principles, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with various departments. Key responsibilities include developing risk management policies, conducting risk assessments, and implementing risk mitigation strategies. The successful candidate will also be responsible for monitoring and reporting on risk exposure, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, and providing training and support to staff on risk management practices. This is a critical role that requires a proactive approach to risk management and the ability to think strategically about potential risks and their impact on the organization.      Your responsibilities:
Provide the overall leadership, vision, and direction for risk management
Provide senior management with all relevant risk-related information to enable them to establish the company's level of risk appetite
Assess the strength and sustainability of the risk strategy and risk appetite and ensure that risk appetite is properly translated into specific risk limits
Establish, maintain and reinforce the Company's integrated risk management framework and architecture to mitigate the overall risk position and improving risk profile of the Company
Develop and implement risk management policies and guidelines in accordance with relevant regulation(Basel, EBA, Bank of Italy regulations etc) and best practice
Develop and implement tools to support risk management process, also by applying innovative technologies
Regularly monitor the company's actual risk profile and evaluate it against its strategic objectives and risk appetite
Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies and actions plans to reduce or manage identified risks
Identify and analyze emerging risks and recommend strategies to mitigate them
Improve the company's risk management readiness through communication and training programs
Ensuring continuous improvement in the Risk Management Practices/policies of the company
Your skills, experience, and qualifications:
Master's degree in quantitative discipline such as Quantitative Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent
3+ years of proven experience within structured companies, from the IT / Banking sector
Excellent knowledge in the field of enterprise risk management and ICT Risk Management
Having ISO31000, ISO27005 and CRISC certifications is a plus
Strong understanding of statistics and quantitative data analysis methods
Excellent relational and problem solving skills, with a strong aptitude for teamworking
Ability to influence a culture of risk awareness in the organization
Fluency in English
What we offer:

Reports to: Commercial Finance Director
Job Purpose

A  Commercial Finance Business Partner  plays a critical role in bridging the gap between finance and business operations, ensuring that financial insights are aligned with the company’s commercial strategies and objectives.

GroupM is looking for a Sr Commercial Finance business partner who will provide analysis and insight to the Commercial Finance Director and Business teams in order to drive profitable growth, optimize decision-making, and ensure that commercial objectives and financial targets are met.

He/She will support the Commercial Finance department in all the activities regarding business planning and analysis at client level. In particular, He/She will be responsible to keep under control the profitability of clients in portfolio across the different business lines, delivering performance analysis over time thanks to the development of dedicated tools and dashboards. He/she will also actively contribute to the development of business cases and economics assessment for clients pitches and new business opportunities.

We expect the candidate to also be able to engage and interact outside the Finance community, to analyze and communicate business and client results to key stakeholders and to participate to the continuous improvement of our internal processes of assessing and monitoring client profitability
Key Responsibilities
Business Partnering :
Partner with key business stakeholders providing analysis and insight and supporting business decision making through the assessment of risks and opportunities.
Collaborate with non-finance teams to ensure financial implications of business decisions are fully understood.
Analyze client profitability and main drivers to support pricing and fee decisions and negotiations.
Analysis & Reporting :
Analyze key business metrics, such as revenue, margin, and profitability by client and business line.
Develop data models to support scenario analysis and new business evaluation.
Track performance against budget and forecasts, providing insight into variances and recommending corrective actions.
Support data modelling, forecasting and analysis of client profitability in order to ensure sound and accurate planning and target setting processes.
Develop decision-making tools for forecasting and planning that will drive the organization to be more effective across client portfolio
Be responsible for data collection, template automation and consolidation

Work closely with IT dept. to maximize the level & accuracy of information available to the business and ensure that the logic & assumptions by which the data is summarized and constructed is in line with objectives and processes of those interpreting the data
Drive the evolution and improvement of tools and reporting and analysis capabilities within the Commercial Finance Team
Required Skills & Competencies:
High Level of analytical skills and experience in an analytical role within Finance department, ideally at a fast paced Company.

An advanced level of computer skills is essential including PowerPoint, Excel and data extraction and analysis tools (e.g. SAS, SQL). Knowledge of data visualization software (Tableau, Power BI) is also required.
Strong knowledge and understanding of analytics tools and experience of extracting and utilizing data
Confident communicator with experience of influencing commercial teams. Ability to present analysis in a clear and concise manner.
Proven ability to draw insight from data and make recommendations.
Proactive not reactive, with ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Confident with learning new tools, technologies, and methodologies.
Commercial Acumen: strong understanding of business operations and the ability to provide actionable insights to drive commercial success
Results-driven and focused on adding value to the business.
Qualifications & Experience
Bachelor or Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or an analytical related field
The successful candidate would have 3/5 years’ experience within a similar role.
Previous experience in commercial finance and analysis departments
This role is ideal for an analytics professional eager to dealing with commercial finance and passionate about influencing business decisions through data analysis insight
Location

Our aim is to become the “go to” provider of technical services.

We enable leading content creators and publishers to leverage our expertise and capacity across the lifecycle of interactive content. In so doing we empower our clients to remain lean and agile, and to focus on creating the most engaging experiences.

Keywords is trusted and relied upon by many of the world’s leading video game companies to work alongside them during concept, development and live operations by leveraging the breadth and depth of our industry leading service lines every step of the way. www.keywordsstudios.com

The successful candidate will be responsible for providing local and frontline support at their locations and will serve as a main point of contact for studios issues while at the same time having a high level of technical knowledge and high level of customer server across instant messaging, email, telephone and face to face interactions.

This is an excellent opportunity for a  Support Bar Analyst (IT Help Desk  with excellent communication and leadership skills, who is looking to make an impact within a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
This role reports to the Head of Local Support and will involve working closely with colleagues in other offices to deliver a seamless service to our users.

A few extra key tasks could be in touch with “End user Experience” team, responsible for ensuring that our clients have seamless access to their business hardware, applications and data while working remotely, and that their mobile devices are secure and also responsible for ensuring that the onsite experience is the same globally by helping to standardise equipment and processes.
Full scope of tasks including but not limited to:
Act as front line support for local and/or time zone based employees.
Serve as the main point of contact for our customers via email, walk ups, and chat support.
Respond promptly and professionally to customer inquiries and troubleshoot issues related to our products and services.
Utilize relevant software and databases to effectively diagnose, track and resolve customer issues and address complaints.
Maintain accurate records, including call logs and ticketing systems, to track customer interactions and issue resolution.
Collaborate with other teams to identify and resolve technical issues.
Stay up to date with industry trends and provide input on continuous improvement to the Helpdesk and customer service workflows.
Identify and escalate issues requiring urgent attention to the appropriate parties.
Ensure SLAs are met and that our internal users are provided with an exceptional user experience.
Ensure that all IT assets in the local office are managed and maintained to a high standard.
Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and legislation related to workplace services, health and safety, and environmental management.
Collaborate with other senior leaders and stakeholders to build a strong culture of innovation, continuous improvement, and learning across the organization
Requirements
Global experience within a business services environment and ideally video games development and/or working in a highly technical development environment.
Strong knowledge of first and second line support operations.
Desirable knowledge of ServiceNow and industry trends.
Excellent relationship building skills.
Ability to work in a matrix management environment.
Proven work experience in a customer service or Helpdesk role.
Excellent communication and active listening skills with a customer-first mindset.
Ability to operate effectively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and multitask effectively.
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new software applications and technologies.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong customer service orientation, with a focus on delivering high-quality services to employees and stakeholders.
Skills and experience desidered
Manage the deployment, configuration, and maintenance of mobile devices, including tablets, smartphones, consoles, Meeting Room solutions (Intune, Autopilot, EMS, MDM, VDI)
Manage the deployment, configuration, and maintenance of user peripherals
Provide 3rd line support for mobility applications to team members, customers
Helping Keywords gain compliancy in Local and global standards (ISO 27001, Cyber Essentials Plus)
Collaborate with other stakeholders to ensure application security and data privacy are maintained
Evaluate emerging technologies and provide recommendations for improving mobility services by closely working with OEMs and Vendors
Develop and maintain technical documentation related to mobility solutions, providing training where needed to other departments on mobility solutions
Basic knowledge of ITIL process.

Welfare & Fringe benefit
A company portal of benefits and discounts
Language courses incentives

20,Italy,https://it.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=ecd2b2d09dd063a9&bb=wH3BCuaXa8EmHcfjMyF1F1pqfbX21GTFyYP4MZ7ROvPPz6NhBax2MAFulbN6-YHxHnGo_Tgdk6zp8ib-QtUEYdxoS0rLwev3cEOfJGYa_e2ZXwszv_Z_myXyxLku2Yx5&xkcb=SoCE67M37LZNvzxYcx0AbzkdCdPP&fccid=b716e44d2c6283e7&vjs=3,Data+Analyst,"Milano, Lombardia","Associate Director OR Senior Analyst - Structured Finance, Ratings Analytical",S&P Global,20121 Milano,Not available,"About the Role:   Grade Level (for internal use):  12    The Team:  The team cover the analysis of ABS and RMBS transactions in EMEA, developing relationships with market players, contributing to research and publications, and representing S&P Global Ratings at market events. Reporting to the Structured Finance Analytical Manager, the role involves close collaboration with highly experienced industry experts, with an important focus on market dynamics.    The Impact:  The successful applicant will enhance our ability to serve clients efficiently and effectively, demonstrating outstanding analytical excellence and the capacity to provide relevant, insightful, and compelling analysis. Responsibilities include aiding in the analysis for the EMEA ABS & RMBS team. There will be direct analytical responsibility for a portfolio of credits, conducting credit and financial analysis, reviewing, researching, and managing data and transaction documents, running credit models, analysing cash flows, and preparing analytical documentation. Knowledge of applicable criteria is essential, along with providing analytical reasoning in team discussions and presenting analyses in committees. Effective communication is crucial, both within the Structured Finance Analytical team and as an ambassador for S&P Global Ratings with market participants, including issuers and key clients, as well as at conferences where participation as a speaker may be required. A deep understanding of industry trends and issues is expected, along with strong organizational skills and a proactive approach to resolving issues.    What you stand to Gain:  This position offers the successful candidate the opportunity to work in a dynamic team environment alongside professional specialists. It allows for the deepening and broadening of insight and knowledge in one of the leading credit ratings companies globally. This role provides exposure to a range of markets and asset types while representing S&P Global Ratings in the EMEA ABS market with investors, regulators, and industry experts.    Responsibilities:  Independently prepare and present analysis and recommendations to credit committees.  Conduct analyses on complex Structured Finance transactions:  reviewing data and documentation, running related credit and cash-flow models, identifying, and measuring appropriate risk factors, and presenting outcomes in front of a rating committee.  Work closely with senior analysts to provide research and analysis for the Structured Finance team.  Participate in analytical educational meetings with clients to provide insights on our analytical approach.  Model S&P leadership behaviours, coach, and mentor junior staff.    What We’re Looking For:  Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or a related subject.  Relevant industry experience in Structured Finance, ABS, RMBS, or credit analysis, or related analytical fields. Strong interpersonal and communication skills.  A S&P employee at this level would typically have 6 or more years of analytical work experience in the financial services industry. We are happy to consider candidates of lesser experience for a Senior Analyst level.  Experience in managing and interpreting data for analytical purposes.  Solid analytical capability, team player, and good time-management skills.  Ability to multi-task and meet project deadlines under tight timeframes.  Self-starter with a proactive attitude and effective team player.  Ability to work under tight deadlines in a fast-changing, global, and regulated environment.  Strong verbal and written communication skills.  Strong Excel knowledge is a must. Good/advanced knowledge of Python and/or R is a distinctive advantage.  Fluent in English and German
column2: proficiency in any other EMEA language is an advantage.   #LI-EY1   About S&P Global Ratings  At S&P Global Ratings, our analyst-driven credit ratings, research, and sustainable finance opinions provide critical insights that are essential to translating complexity into clarity so market participants can uncover opportunities and make decisions with conviction. By bringing transparency to the market through high-quality independent opinions on creditworthiness, we enable growth across a wide variety of organizations, including businesses, governments, and institutions.  S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE:  SPGI). S&P Global is the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks, analytics and workflow solutions in the global capital, commodity and automotive markets. With every one of our offerings, we help many of the world’s leading organizations navigate the economic landscape so they can plan for tomorrow, today.   For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings   What’s In It For You?    Our Purpose:  Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world.   Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress.    Our People:  We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.   From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.    Our Values:  Integrity, Discovery, Partnership   At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.    Benefits:  We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.    Our benefits include:   Health & Wellness:  Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.    Flexible Downtime:  Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.    Continuous Learning:  Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.    Invest in Your Future:  Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.    Family Friendly Perks:  It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.    Beyond the Basics:  From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.  For more information on benefits by country visit:  https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries    Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global:  At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation – Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn’t stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all.   S&P Global has a Securities Disclosure and Trading Policy (“the Policy”) that seeks to mitigate conflicts of interest by monitoring and placing restrictions on personal securities holding and trading. The Policy is designed to promote compliance with global regulations. In some Divisions, pursuant to the Policy’s requirements, candidates at S&P Global may be asked to disclose securities holdings. Some roles may include a trading prohibition and remediation of positions when there is an effective or potential conflict of interest. Employment at S&P Global is contingent upon compliance with the Policy.   -----------------------------------------------------------   Equal Opportunity Employer  S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.   If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.    US Candidates Only:  The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.   ----------------------------------------------------------- 202 - Middle Professional (EEO Job Group) (inactive), 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), RATNGS202.2 - Middle Professional Tier II (EEO Job Group)    Job ID:  307055  Posted On:  2024-09-17  Location:  Frankfurt, Germany"

20,Italy,https://it.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=12f1ef438c4c0454&bb=wH3BCuaXa8EmHcfjMyF1F4nnjhtIeXW-wwlbOvKbwZRAinN4k4sdTbUJY5FVQhIF30Q3zpJS8IU__P_cz8NhPQ7ver5_o2sZ-b8-NPkmkNGUuk51B-CZDg%3D%3D&xkcb=SoC-67M37LZNvzxYcx0GbzkdCdPP&fccid=835a0993ec5de1a4&vjs=3,Data+Analyst,"Milano, Lombardia",Senior Payroll Analyst,Brown-Forman,"Milano, Lombardia",Not available,"Meaningful Work From Day One

The position will be responsible for the on-going administration of an outsourced payroll process in Europe, primarily for (but not limited to) Italy. Over time, the role will also become familiar with the payroll processes and vendor relationships, and could expand over other Europe payrolls in order to assist local staff and outsourced vendors with accurate and timely payroll execution.

The Senior Payroll Analyst role will partner with local payroll point persons, local payroll vendors, local banks, third-party vendors (taxes, benefits, etc), HR, Benefits, Compensation, IT, time/leave administrators, HR Master Data Management, and accounting to ensure the end-to-end payroll process is completed compliantly, accurately, and timely. At times, the payroll analyst may be called upon to back-up payroll processing in various countries. This position will also be involved in projects across various countries.
What You Can Expect
Working with vendors, executing the monthly payroll for Italy.
Implementing a new Italy payroll entity and working in end to end testing for go live execution.

Building relationships with local payroll point persons in each European country, as well as with their payroll providers. Becoming highly acquainted with their payroll processes and calendars, and keeping such information current in the payroll knowledge base.
Being prepared to back-up processing in various countries as needed.

Liaise with all stakeholders that influence payroll results to ensure monthly and annual processes, such as Benefits Annual Enrollment, Benefits vendor transition, Global Payroll Project, and Expense Processing vendor transition, run accurately and efficiently.
Perform root cause analysis and develop short and long-term means to address troublesome or inefficient processing issues.

Become proficient with Workday Worksheets as well as the business processes in the Workday system that affect payroll (leave/time off, pay codes (deductions/earnings) and integrations. Work with various countries to optimize the use of Workday for payroll activities.

Partner with all stakeholders in the payroll process to ensure systems and processes are utilized to the maximum efficiency. Utilize technology to ensure continuous process improvement through more efficient and streamlined procedures.
Monitor T&E/Concur system integrations with Workday. Analyze and troubleshoot integration issues, and reconcile transactions loaded in Workday against the Concur system.
Ensure expat data is delivered to the external tax service provider each month. Research questions as they arise and perform reconciliations as needed.
Participate in testing periodic upgrades to Workday and ensure all test scripts are executed properly and any testing errors are resolved.
Ensure continuous professional growth and development through internal and external workshops and seminars.
What You Bring to the Table
Significant European and specifically Italian payroll experience & other outsourced payroll administration and legislative experience utilizing a top-tier human capital management system.
Experience with payroll interrelationships with accounting and General Ledger (GL).
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications with an emphasis in Excel, Word and PowerPoint, including advanced features.
Superb attention to detail and ability to review large amounts of data efficiently.
Exceptional customer service skills, communication skills, and high level of professionalism and courtesy in highly charged situations.
Possess strong interpersonal skills
column2: able to develop and maintain effective working relationships with all levels of internal and external stakeholders.

column1: Fluent in English

Possess the highest level of integrity, diplomacy, and confidentiality. Able to work independently, execute responsibilities, and meet all deadlines with planning, organization, and accuracy in a high volume, deadline-oriented environment.
Strong mathematical skills with ability to research, analyze, reconcile, and resolve complex time and payroll issues.
Work a flexible schedule and overtime when necessary.
What Makes You Unique
Working knowledge of Workday, SAP, or PeopleSoft HCM systems.
Professional payroll certification as appropriate in Europe
Demonstrated ability to maintain routine business processes while participating in projects that improve the workflows and processes within the organization.
Preferred experience includes an educational background in HR, Finance, or Accounting.
Who We Are

We believe great people build great brands. And we know there is Nothing Better in the Market than a career at Brown-Forman. Being a part of Brown-Forman means you will grow both personally and professionally. You will have the opportunity to solve problems, seize opportunities, and generate bold ideas. You will belong to a place where teamwork matters and where you are encouraged to bring your best self to work.

Many Spirits, One Brown‑Forman-  We believe that an inclusive culture, one that values the diversity and unique perspective of each individual, allows us each to bring our best self to work and leads to greater teamwork, creativity, and trust.
Cultivating a Caring Culture-  We know that our strong culture is one of the many reasons people love working at Brown‑Forman.

Nothing Better-  At Brown‑Forman, we craft products known for bringing people together. Our employees have made us what we are today and are the reason for our success. Do not just take our word for it. Brown‑Forman is consistently recognized as a Great Place to Work® in countries around the world.
What We Offer

Total Rewards at Brown-Forman is designed to engage our people to ensure sustainable and profitable growth for generations to come. As a premium spirits company, we offer equitable pay structures for individual and company performance alongside a premium employee experience. We offer a range of premium benefits that reflect our company values and meet the needs of our diverse workforce.

20,Italy,https://it.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=693f98962ae44bae&bb=wH3BCuaXa8EmHcfjMyF1F6SuW044tsKOmmRmcZKiXiONCHEm4Tw9H1yJLtzN3g2xqVXLYDnD19ND1bfQSlvscT3aY9z8TBJq9iwtzbnqhjkuH02znrkAnrgo1r1tvBAP&xkcb=SoAj67M37LZNvzxYcx0FbzkdCdPP&fccid=05f0269cad780155&vjs=3,Data+Analyst,"Milano, Lombardia",Senior Business Performance Manager,Unobravo,"Remoto in Milano, Lombardia",Not available,"Leading the way in digital mental healthcare, Unobravo stands as a trusted and empathetically in people's lives, caring for their mental health and supporting their personal growth. From the very beginning, our daily mission has been to revolutionize society's perception of mental health by breaking down the stigma surrounding it.

At the core of Unobravo's success is our exceptional team, committed to providing accessible, high-level care anytime, anywhere. With more than 2 million therapy sessions, we have positively impacted countless lives, promoting psychological well-being and helping individuals overcome life's challenges.

Unobravo's journey is heating up as we are actively expanding across Europe. We're bringing our game-changing approach to diverse markets, gearing up to challenge and transform global perspectives on mental health. This expansion marks a thrilling chapter in reshaping the world's view of mental wellness.

To take our company to an international level, we are currently looking for  Sr Business Performance Manager  to join our team, reporting directly to the COO:  This position offers real opportunities to drive innovation in the mental health landscape, providing clarity to our business dynamics and drivers to create profound international impact. We are looking for who are willing to push boundaries, ramping up our global game and totally changing the script of how we address mental health challenges in different markets .
AS A  SR BUSINESS PERFORMANCE MANAGER  YOU WILL:

Champion the creation of a comprehensive KPI framework to monitor Unobravo’s performance throughout the customer journey and key strategic areas: Acquisition, Product, Supply, Operations, Monetization, B2B, and International Expansion.
Organize and facilitate business performance meetings (Weekly Business Reviews/Monthly Business Reviews). Define the format and produce the necessary deliverables.

Proactively identify and investigate trends in close collaboration with key company stakeholders.Provide clear explanations for any fluctuations in KPIs and their drivers. Communicate findings and recommendations to the leadership team and respond to their inquiries and follow-up requests as needed.
Identify recurrent reporting needs and lead the development of the appropriate data products to fulfill them, in partnership with the analytics engineering and data analytics teams.
Address inquiries and requests from company investors. Assist in preparing for board meetings and support any future fundraising activities.
Assist the leadership team and their functions by analyzing customer and business problems, aiming to identify opportunities for accelerated growth and inform strategic decisions.
️  YOU WILL BE A GREAT FIT IF YOU HAVE:
At least 3 years experience as a Business Analyst / Data Analyst in fast-paced technology companies.
Experience liaising with C-level stakeholders.
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem  finding  skills. A true obsession with getting to the bottom of things.
Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses
Strong written and verbal communication skills. B1 English is a must.
Availability to work independently in full remote.
Nice to have:
Background in management or strategy consulting.
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C).
Domain of Data Visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.)
Programming skills in SQL or other relevant languages.
WHAT WE OFFER:
Remote-Working at the Top

Join a team that embraces the future of work and takes the well-being of its people seriously. We support a healthy work-life balance with a smart approach that allows you to work from anywhere that suits your lifestyle and choices.
Coworking Meetings

Break free from the ordinary and push all boundaries! Unobravo has dedicated a special budget to encourage global teamwork, in order to enable employees and collaborators to meet in coworking spaces in many many cities around the world.
Business Growth on the Horizon
Step into a work environment that's in constant motion, always growing, and ever-evolving. Be part of a company that's on the rise!
‍️  Online Yoga and Fitness Fun
We're invested in your physical and mental wellness. Join our free online yoga and fitness classes to stay in shape and find your zen.
Team Building and Epic Events

Get ready for extraordinary adventures! Dive into thrilling team-building activities and attend our fabulous corporate events and nationwide  aperitivo  parties that will keep you buzzing with excitement!
Company Conventions and Valuable Partnerships
Discover a world of incredible opportunities and exclusive benefits through our B2B conventions and partnerships. Your gateway to extraordinary advantages!
Expand your Mind and Linguistic Repertoire

Make your way through our training and language courses, it's the perfect time to unleash your curiosity and give yourself a gift of personal growth. We have a world of opportunities and a secret language for success in store for you!
Birthday Off
Celebrating the passing of time is also fun at Unobravo! In fact, all employees can enjoy a day off spendable month of your birthday.
Sleep Consulting: Online Seminars on Infant Sleep
Dive into the exclusive seminars that we offer, providing a distinctive chance to enhance the sleep quality of your precious little angels.
Are you ready to make a difference with us?

At Unobravo, we strive every day to create an inclusive work environment based on deep mutual respect and equal opportunity. Our mission, our deepest purpose, is to ensure that each person, with their individual qualities, is recognized and valued. We want to promote the well-being of everyone who is part of our reality.

We know that everyone brings with them a unique set of experiences, skills and challenges. For this very reason, even if you may not have all of the technical skills required, if your work history does not seem perfectly aligned with what we seek, or if you belong to protected categories, we sincerely ask that you still consider the opportunity.

We understand that many people, for different reasons, may need additional support to apply or to participate fairly in our interview process. If you require reasonable accommodation, whatever it may be, to make the process more accessible, please indicate this in the last question of the application form. We will do everything we can to ensure you have a fair and smooth application process."

Raccolta e pulizia dei dati :
Estrarre e raccogliere dati da diverse fonti (database interni, file CSV, API, ecc.).
Pulire e preparare i dati per l'analisi, garantendo la qualità e l'integrità dei dataset.
Analisi esplorativa dei dati :
Condurre analisi esplorative per identificare pattern, trend e insight utili al business.
Supportare il team nell'identificazione di opportunità di miglioramento e ottimizzazione dei processi.
Creazione di report e dashboard:
Creare report periodici e ad-hoc utilizzando strumenti di Business Intelligence (BI) come Excel, Power BI, Tableau o Google Data Studio.
Aggiornare e mantenere dashboard interattive per monitorare KPI
Collaborazione interfunzionale :
Collaborare con diversi team aziendali (marketing, vendite, finanza) per comprendere le loro esigenze analitiche e fornire soluzioni basate sui dati.
Supportare progetti di analisi avanzata con il team senior o il Data Scientist.
Automatizzazione di processi di analisi :
Supportare l'automatizzazione dei processi di estrazione e analisi dei dati per migliorare l'efficienza operativa.
Creare e gestire script (ad esempio in Python, SQL) per facilitare l'analisi dei dati.
Requisiti:
Laurea triennale o specialistica in Informatica, Statistica, Matematica o settori affini.
Conoscenza di strumenti di analisi dati come SQL, Excel, Python o R.
Capacità di analizzare dati complessi e presentare report chiari e dettagliati.
Abilità di problem-solving e attenzione ai dettagli.
Proattività e predisposizione al lavoro di squadra.
Altre informazioni:
Synergie svolgerà i colloqui durante lo Speed Date STEM a Napoli del 9 ottobre , dedicato a laureandi e neolaureati STEM in cerca di lavoro.
Per un colloquio con Synergie iscriviti all’evento, sarai ricontattato.
L'evento è a numero chiuso, sarai contattato nei prossimi giorni per tutti i dettagli."

Posizione:
In Staff alla divisione Finance la risorsa, in qualità di Data Analyst, sarà allocata su attività di analisi e gestione dati dei processi aziendali e su analisi descrittive e multidimensionali.
Nello specifico avrà le seguenti responsabilità:
analisi dei dati di mercato
estrapolazione e analisi dati da sistemi gestionali e creazione di report ad hoc
aggregazione dati, individuando le metodologie di analisi più idonee
interpretazione del dato e analisi critica dello stesso
analisi ed implementazione degli algoritmi utili alla definizione del pricing dei prodotti
analisi dei costi delle linee dei prodotti
supporto alle attività di miglioramento delle linee di prodotto
implementazione e supporto delle strategie definite per cliente e/o cluster e/o prodotto.
Requisiti:

Il/La candidato/a ideale  ha già maturato una esperienza lavorativa in ruoli quali  Data Analyst , preferibilmente in una azienda che opera nel nostro stesso mercato di riferimento, ha  un background fortemente analitico  e orientamento al problem solving. Laurea vecchio ordinamento o laurea specialistica in  materie STEM .
Ha ottima conoscenza del Pacchetto Office, in particolare di EXCEL (formule e Pivot)
column2: ottima conoscenza del linguaggio SQL, preferibilmente anche di Python e/o R.

column1: Altre informazioni:
L’inquadramento e la retribuzione  saranno commisurati all’esperienza effettivamente maturata.
La sede di lavoro sarà stabilita a  Napoli , si richiede comunque massima flessibilità e disponibilità a trasferte sul territorio nazionale."

Do Work That Matters - Il tuo ruolo e le tue responsabilità

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse.

KPMG Open Platform  è il nostro nuovo Hub innovativo con sede a  Napoli  creato per sviluppare modelli di servizio e soluzioni ad alto contenuto tecnologico per le imprese e la Pubblica Amministrazione. Le aree di intervento includono Cyber Security, Program Management su grandi cantieri di trasformazione del settore Pubblico, Application Maintenance e Managed Services.

Entrando a far parte del  Team PMO , contribuirai operativamente alla gestione e al coordinamento delle attività amministrative afferenti ai progetti, con focus sull’analisi ed interpretazione di informazioni e dati numerici.
Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:
Supportare il/i Project Manager nella  pianificazione e monitoraggio delle attività amministrative  dei progetti (es: fatturazioni, consuntivazioni, etc.).
Raccogliere, verificare, e gestire dati/informazioni , documenti e/o materiali anche al fine di renderli fruibili ai destinatari.
Analizzare e interpretare  i dati e le informazioni elaborate (qualitative o quantitative), in base agli obiettivi e alle richieste pervenute.
Collaborare alla preparazione della documentazione di sintesi sugli  avanzamenti del progetto  e di  report periodici  sia interni sia esterni alla società.
Monitorare e aggiornare gli avanzamenti delle attività amministrative  dei progetti, assicurandosi che le scadenze vengano rispettate.
Produrre e presentare report, dashboard, slide e/o relazioni scritte afferenti ai risultati delle analisi che saranno richieste dai Project Manager

Avrai l’opportunità di crescere professionalmente e affrontare sfide stimolanti, partecipando a progetti che mirano ad aiutare i prestigiosi clienti del nostro network a gestire le sfide più complesse legate a momenti di discontinuità e trasformazione, contribuendo al loro successo.
Come As  You  Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:
Hai una Laurea triennale e/o magistrale in discipline economiche, gestionali o affini.
Hai una conoscenza base delle  metodologie di gestione progetti  (es. Agile, PMI).
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Hai capacità  di problem solving, pensiero critico, logico e analitico .
Hai capacità di  gestione del tempo , delle priorità, delle risorse e dei risultati, con attenzione al dettaglio e al rispetto delle scadenze.
Ti piace lavorare in team  e possiedi ottime doti collaborative e relazionali anche nei confronti di persone provenienti da altre aree aziendali, con ruoli e livelli eterogenei.
Your Future With Us – Cosa troverai in KPMG Open Platform
Un ambiente di  lavoro inclusivo , equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le  diversità
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la  creatività  e il  lavoro di squadra
Modalità di lavoro  ibrida,  per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di  formazione  e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset  internazionale  e  progettualità innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul  benessere psicofisico
Un’organizzazione che si impegna per generare un  impatto sociale  e sul  territorio
Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i  Valori di KPMG  che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di  esprimere tutto il loro potenziale .

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un  ambiente di lavoro inclusivo , il nostro Network ha ottenuto le  certificazioni ISO 30415 , che attesta la conformità del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e  UNI PdR 125 , che certifica la parità di genere. All’interno del nostro  Impact Plan  -  bit.ly/OurImpactPlanKPMG  - trovi riassunte tutte le  azioni concrete  che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance ( ESG ).
Unisciti a noi!

KPMG Open Platform  è il nostro nuovo Hub innovativo con sede a  Napoli  creato per sviluppare modelli di servizio e soluzioni ad alto contenuto tecnologico per le imprese e la Pubblica Amministrazione. Le aree di intervento includono Cyber Security, Program Management su grandi cantieri di trasformazione del settore Pubblico, Application Maintenance e Managed Services.

Entrando a far parte del  Team AMS MES , sarai impegnata/o nel garantire il successo dei cambiamenti digitali legati alla  Industry 4.0 e Smart Manufacturing . Lavorerai a stretto contatto con colleghe e colleghi esperti nell’implementazione di  soluzioni digitali avanzate , garantendo l'efficienza operativa dei sistemi e supportando efficacemente i processi di Business, con particolare focus sulle più recenti tecnologie software applicate al contesto produttivo .
Nello specifico verrai coinvolto nelle seguenti attività:
Supportare gli utenti rispondendo alle domande ""How to"" per telefono o tramite ticket e spiegando come correggere manualmente gli input errati
Risolvere problemi di sistema minori utilizzando la procedura di emergenza, quando necessario
Analizzare problemi complessi relativi ai processi di fabbrica
Implementare le richieste di servizio, come modifiche al sistema, sessioni di formazione, caricamento/modifica massiva di dati
Implementare sistemi ed architetture JAVA EE, nonché frontend/web standards e framework per SPA (es: SapUI 5, AngularJS)
Realizzare query con vari DBMS
Aggiornare la documentazione nei casi sopra citati.

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i  Valori di KPMG  che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di  esprimere tutto il loro potenziale .

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un  ambiente di lavoro inclusivo , il nostro Network ha ottenuto le  certificazioni ISO 30415 , che attesta la conformità del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e  UNI PdR 125 , che certifica la parità di genere. All’interno del nostro  Impact Plan  -  bit.ly/OurImpactPlanKPMG  - trovi riassunte tutte le  azioni concrete  che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance ( ESG ).
Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Open Platform S.r.l SB garantisce le pari opportunità.
The chance to build a better future is right in front of you
Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges.

KPMG Open Platform is our new innovative hub based in Naples, created to develop high-tech service models and solutions for businesses and public administration. Areas of focus include Cyber Security, Program Management on large public sector transformation sites, Application Maintenance, and Managed Services.

Joining the AMS SAP Team, you will be engaged in managing business change processes related to the maintenance and optimization of SAP platforms. You will work closely with experienced colleagues in the implementation of advanced digital solutions, ensuring the operational efficiency of systems and effectively supporting business processes.
Specifically, you will be responsible for:
Analyzing business processes  and identifying areas for improvement
Designing and implementing  customized SAP solutions
Providing ongoing support for the  maintenance and optimization  of SAP platforms
Conducting end-user  training  and workshops
Monitoring  the performance of SAP systems and proposing improvement  solutions .

You will have the opportunity to grow professionally and take on exciting challenges, participating in projects that aim to help our network's prestigious clients manage the most complex challenges associated with times of discontinuity and transformation, contributing to their success.
Come As You Are - Your Skills and Characteristics
This opportunity is perfect for you if:
You have a technical school diploma or a degree in management engineering, economics, computer engineering, or a similar field
You have a deep passion for Digital transformation and innovation
You have a good command of the  English   language , preferably with study and/or work experience abroad
Knowledge of SAP and/or familiarity with programming languages will be considered a plus.
Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG Open Platform
An  inclusive , equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values  diversity
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and  teamwork
Hybrid  work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
Advanced  training  and development programs to stay current
An  international mindset  and  innovative projects
Initiatives focused on mental and  physical well-being
An organization committed to generating  social  and  local   impact .
Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community, and integrity: these are the values of KPMG that create an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to express their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our network has obtained  ISO 30415 certification , which certifies compliance with the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and  UNI PdR 125  certification, which certifies gender equality. Inside our  Impact Plan  - bit.ly/OurImpactPlanKPMG - you will find a summary of all the  concrete actions  we are taking on environmental, social, and governance ( ESG ) issues.
Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy."

Part of the MSC Group, MSC Cruises is the market leader in the Mediterranean, South Africa and South America, and sails year-round in the Mediterranean and the Caribbean. Its seasonal itineraries cover northern Europe, the Atlantic Ocean, South America, southern Africa, and the Persian/Arabian Gulf. MSC Cruises was born in the Mediterranean, and draws inspiration from this heritage to create a unique experience for holidaymakers worldwide. As a result of a euro 6.5 billions investment programme launched in 2003, MSC Cruises' fleet comprises 13 state-of-the-art cruise ships belonging to four different classes: Lirica, Musica, Fantasia and Meraviglia. The fleet's average age is 7 years, the youngest in the industry. In 2014, MSC Cruises launched a euro 9 billion, 10 year investment plan to support the second phase of its growth through the order of up to 11 next generation mega cruise ships. As a result, MSC Cruises' fleet will double by 2026, while the passenger capacity will triple to reach five million passengers per year. MSC Cruises is the first cruise company to develop an investment plan of this length and magnitude. MSC Cruises feels a deep responsibility for the environments in which it operates, and was the first company ever to earn the Bureau Veritas ""7 Golden Pearls"" for superior management and environmental stewardship. In 2009, MSC Cruises began an enduring partnership with UNICEF to support various programmes assisting children worldwide."
